It plays more like a tv show if made for tv movie. And because it caters more to women...it felt soapy.While it was a solid 1 for me
I rate it a 4 because it's a step in the right direction. Where more lanes if entertainment are being opened. So everyone can identify with the lead(s) actor. But, for the money they spent in this movie....at better quality is needed for the ladies if my house. And if made better. I think all audiences might have enjoyed it.There is really strong female characters and stories that have been made. Use those as blueprints.

title: Outstanding humor and overall excellence.
text: "The Marvels" stands as a cinematic masterpiece, weaving together exceptional humor and stellar performances that leave a lasting impact. Iman Vellani's portrayal is a revelation, infusing the character with depth and charm. Brie Larson's return as Captain Marvel is a triumphant display of her acting prowess, satisfying the anticipation of fans like myself who admire her talent. Zawe Ashton's casting as Loki's wife is a stroke of genius, as her performance adds a layer of complexity to the narrative. Teyonah Parris, as Maria Rambabu, steals scenes with her compelling presence. The film's narrative contribution to the Marvel Cinematic Universe is monumental, offering a rich tapestry of storytelling that expands the franchise's horizons. The ensemble cast's chemistry is palpable, creating moments of genuine connection that resonate with audiences. In conclusion, "The Marvels" is a must-see for its perfect blend of humor, action, and nuanced performances, solidifying its place as a standout gem in the Marvel universe.

title: They need to get back on track.
text: This was so dumb, they make an all male movie they complain but watch it and it's entertaining. They make an all female movie and it's unwatchable but want to make a small group happy.Kamala crying and screaming was unbearable, the story was a mess and unoriginal. They forced an unwanted antagonist that brought very little to the movie.Even the special effects were not up to the usual standards. They started amazing then just in like some recent movies there were scenes that were just bad.There were so many great stories that they could have gone with but they just thought that we would watch what they throw at us but those days are about to end if they don't get back to what got them here. Stop trying to make everyone comfortable and just make good movies.

title: No
text: Just no. Seriously how was this made? Who sat there and said yeah this is good let's release it. Everything about this movie screams NO. The CGI looks worse than if a youtuber did it in their basement. The writing is more cringe than if a 3 yr old wrote it. Black girl power..wow just wow...whoever wrote this has no idea how to make strong female leads..look at Aliens, Tomb Raider, Scream.. all incredibly strong female leads with actual character building not just focus on their skin and think that amkes them strong...the whole thing was pathetic and its time to end this garbage. It's offensive that they think people or so dumb and fickle that they would even consider making this. The audacity is mind boggling. The audience deserves better.

title: Stop complaining
text: I don't get it. The action sequences were well brilliant, the settings across different planets were great and the story was a typical simple progression with a bit of fleshing out. The cast were brilliant. What are people complaining about. I really enjoyed the film the action the humour and hated the villain. Stop complaining, stop willing Marvel to fail sit back and enjoy.You would definitely benefit from watching Ms Marvel the series as well as obviously captain marvel. Wandervision would also be a plus but not needed. The chemistry between the cast was amongst the best in the films and I loved the fresh take on making the movie relatable to the every day person in an established universe.

title: worst marvel movie (yet)
text:
It's hard to grasp how bad this movie is
acting is so bad it's awkward
plot doesn't make any sense
literally painful to watch
zane ashton is the only character that does some ok acting
most of the plot is absurd, argumentation is pointless, many thing are not explained, solutions to problems are idiotic and there is a sense yo extremely forced inclusion
random music/choreography makes it even more strange and out of place. At least if the songs were good or catchy it would be justified, but it's just cringe and annoying
it is not clear to what type of public this is pointing to, what is clear is that you have to lack common sense to enjoy it.

title: Young Avengers will fail!
text: If this movie is any indication of what the Young Avengers will become, then the Young Avengers is doomed to fail.Don't get me wrong - I loved the first Captain Marvel movie. It was amazing. For the second Captain Marvel movie, I expected more of the same.Instead, screen time had to be shared with two other "Captain Marvel want-to-be's". And neither one of them delivered - especially the child. She was completely unbelievable, and destroyed the fourth wall during the entire movie.I wonder who Disney thinks is going to buy $20 movie tickets to see children pretend to be superheroes. Who is going to drive this child audience to the movie theater? Because they won't be able to drive themselves!Disney is making a HUGE mistake taking the franchise in the direction of a child target audience.

title: What the?
text: Apparently this is based on, or follows on from, a TV show that I have not seen. It shows. The first 30 minutes (and this is not unusual for a Marvel movie) was a confusing flurry of special effects and ernest dialogue that meant very little to me.Then something that looked like a coherent story line started to emerge.Then more fighting and "seen it a million times before and they don't look that great" special effects.Then some human nature bits.Then a finale, which as far as we could make out could have happened right at the beginning if they had thought of it and saved us all a couple of hours.Mildly interesting twist at the end, though the concept was not original.I don't know if this got a cinematic release, but it feels a bit straight to video (or straight to streaming, as it would be these days).

title: Fun but by the book
text: The Marvels is the latest movie in a new stage of MCU movies after Endgame. While we Know Captain Marvel form the original movie the 2 new heroes were introduce in Disney + shows off the big screen: Ms Marvel and Wandavission. But at least they have enough content to fill you in is you missed these shows.Our leads have great chemistry working well together. And we quickly get to know them so we can care about them. Kamala Khan, Ms Marvel, is well written, a young fan-girl that is easily excitable. The trope is not overplayed and unlike overly excitable characters in the past they don't overdo it to the point of annoyance.We get to see more of the universe form unique planets and aliens to families craters. They looks great and each has a unique personality. They actually manage to showcase worlds and cultures that are not cookie cutter version of ones we have seen over and over again. The movie also doesn't take itself too seriously. At times it feels more connected to GOTG then the MCU as a whole.Where this move dose fall short is the villain. We again see the Kree as the villain. She's not menacing and her motives are less about doing back things but helping her people in the wrong way. It's another example of a light villain that is borderline an antihero.

title: How did this get made?
text: Iman Vellani was endearing and has good comedic timing. Other than that, I have nothing positive to say about this movie. Kevin Feige needs to retire. Marvel has lost its way. What was fun and creative in Thor Ragnorak has devolved into fully jumping the shark.Also the characters were so poorly developed. Bree Larson, who has acted capably in other movies, had about as much personality as a plank of wood. The dynamic between the women had just a silly training montage in which to be developed.The stupidity of the water planet and the cat monsters was just garbage. I suppose they were trying to appeal to young girls with a fairytale fantasy of marrying a handsome prince? That's the only explanation I could come up with.Just lazy film making, mostly terrible acting and a disservice to the women who this film was supposedly meant to appeal to.

title: They are trying to ruin the most successful franchise in history
text: This movie made me cringe so many times! Could have been great like the 1st Capitan Marvel. I really hope the studio can turn it around! I have loved almost every movie put of regardless of cast or plot line, but it seems to me that the studio has lost its way on good story telling or building up to the next great movie. I think they are under the impression that just because it's made by Marvel it's going to be a hit. Please take a look at why this movie failed and promise you will never attempt to make something this awful again! I would normally give a Marvel movie a pass because the next movie will surely be better but they seem to have lost all connection with the real fan base that made them so successful. RIP Marvel.

title: Missed opportunity
text: My first bug bear is that once again there is a huge reliance on the viewer to understand what is going on. Literally nothing is explained. Why is Fury on a space station? Who is Monica Rambeau? As a viewer you are on the back foot from the start if you haven't seen the 20 films and 4 TV series required and it's hard to catch up. It feels like this film has undergone significant post production changes. Some of Cpt Marvel's interactions with other characters are all over the place and they can't make up their mind as to what her character is experiencing. There are some good moments, the action sequences when they swap places are energetic and fast paced, and the short amount of time the 3 characters are on the ship together is fun. Iman Vellani is again enthusiastic and plays the role of the audience, just a shame they don't build a strong story around her. Marvel needs to work on grounding some of these stories in the "real" world again to allow the audience to connect with the characters.

title: So bad they should pay you to watch it
text: By far the worst movie I've ever seen. I didn't expect much, as I just went with 2 friends who wanted to see a Marvel film.Terrible special effects, awful acting, cringey jokes, embarrassingly bad fight scenes and a storyline (if you can call it that) to make you want to jump off a bridge.Even if you were getting paid to watch this movie I would still say no as it's not worth the torture you will have to go through during the experience.I would of left the cinema early, especially when they all started to sing, but one of my friends actually enjoyed it and wanted to watch it.Maybe suitable for 11 years old and under.

title: Good MCU movie that deserves a chance
text: Really sorry to see this doing poorly at the box office as it will likely end the stories of these characters. Not sure why either. While it's not my all time favorite, the characters have depth, the acting is good, the story is interesting, the action is good, it's got another relatable antagonist (you get why they are doing what they are doing even if you don't agree with it), and it's just a fun movie. To all those who worked hard on it, you deserved for it to do better. For those who haven't seen it, give it a chance. These characters deserve a place in the MCU and the actresses do a good job of bringing them to life.

title: What was going on
text: I have some much beef with this movie. Firstly aside from the countless movies you've to watch you also have to watch an additional 18 hours of TV shows to know what's going on here and I've only watched like 6 hours worth cause they're hot garbage. Marvels ability to keep viewer retention has to be at an all time low.The only good thing I csn think of about this movie is the dynamic between the main characters. At the start it feels kinda force but eventually they do turn into a well running team. Also the ending scene was pretty cold.Marvel movies usually do have pretty lazy writing but this really takes the cake. The dialogue wasn't the wort ever but it wasn't great either. The whole explain through some random mind bracelet really annoyed me. Really don't need so much pointless exposition. Also who was the villian in this movie. I finished the movie an hour ago and I couldn't tell you a single thing about them. What was their name? What was their goal? Why were they evil? I've literally no idea. Don't even know what actually happened them tbh. Ronan the accuser wannabe. Captain Marvel is one of my favourite mcu character but this was just so mediocre.5/10.

title: This movie failed at every aspect they attempted
text:
Everything was either done poorly, half assed or haphazardly. The only character development was done outside of the movie itself.They turned Nick Fury into comic relief which is in direct conflict with his character in every other appearance. There were so many aspects and ideas that if they flushed out and did properly or even explained in a competent manner the movie wold have been passable. I streamed this movie through Disney+ and I still wish I could have my money and time back. The only thing that was nice is that Brie Larson felt human in this. That's it. That's the only redeeming aspect. Even then they didn't give us nearly enough of why she's better. Or proper character development and conflict resolution.Bad Storytelling
Bad Worldbuilding
Bad Explanations (if any)
Bad Antagonist Development
Mediocre Costuming
Decent Sfx / cgi for the Heroes only.

title: best of fifth phase
text: It was the best movie in the fifth phase of the Marvel Cinematic Universe. I loved the high-quality visual and sound effects, and the performance of our three heroines, they have Great chemistry. The Marvels represents a triumph. The depth it offers can be seen not only in its characters, but also in its story, which explores the complex repercussions of war and the funny and interwoven virtues of family. The strength of The Marvels is certainly its cast of characters, but the comedy comes in a close second. Teaming up to stop an intergalactic revenge plot doesn't sound like a "funny" story, but this story is full of funny situations from beginning to end.

title: I hope you're on IMDB before seing the movie
text: I wish I would've read the reviews first or at least check them after the first 10 minutes. One of the worst movies I've ever seen. No plot, no character development, it's like they struggled to fill in every minute of it. The dancing and singing scene was umbareable to watch.Apparently I cannot submit a review shorter than 600 characters, even though I don't know what more to say about this horrible movie. Much like it, please stop reading my review, don't waste your time.Needless to say that I will not pay to see another Marvel film after their greed exceeded common sense with Thor and this one.

title: Brie, when did you know?
text: Flash, bang, boom, followed by blah blah blah. Imagine a waste of situps and electricity so epic it deserves ExxonMobil logo placement.A Marvel musical? I find myself wishing there was another rating for movies like this. MB for Mel Brooks satire worthy.I can do this! You're too late! That's not how family works!And kittens, oh my.Like this review, boated to fit a required form factor without regard to how it gets there.I loved you Captain and you took advantage.When ideas fail -- fill with fist fights to save the Universe, and platitudes?Someone needs to be black-balled so this never happens again. Our Universe depends on it.

title: I thought we had enough of musicals in Eternals...
text: This latest Marvel film has Carol Danvers (Brie Larson) team up with Monica Rambeau (Teyonah Parris) and Kamala Khan (Iman Vellani), also known as Ms Marvel, after a chain of events that fuses and intertwines the three's super powers together. Oh yeah and Nick Fury (Samuel L Jackson) is here too. I still find it hard to believe we are where we are today with this cinematic universe.Let's start off with what I thought was alright. Iman Vellani as Kamala Khan is just a great casting choice. Like she carried her show, the heart of this movie is definitely her. She has wonderful comedic timing and a childish charm. I guess Carol and Monica's reunion were fine too, although not given enough focus and attention for it to stick. For a change, the post credit scene was fantastic in my opinion. It reignited my hype for what's to come. Other than that, I am afraid this film really didn't stand a chance.There is a scene here that absolutely baffled me where the movie just shifts into a musical. Yup, you read it right. The dialouge was just so over the top cringe and just didn't suit the characters at all. Nick Fury here is just in for comic relief, which is alright to do so but with the correct character. I see zero comparison with the Nick we saw in 'Secret Invasion' versus the Nick in this film. The villain here is forgettable, she has no compassion to her cause and is just plain boring.CGI here was standard. Not the worst I have seen and not really impressive. I find recent MCU films have these bland visuals that don't carry the name and spectacle that is the MCU.Not my favorite, not even close. Going forward, I hope we will see films or TV shows that do justice by these beloved characters.

title: A Fun, heartfelt, heroic adventure.
text: Saw this on opening day in my local IMAX and was swept along by the space adventure of the team up between Carol, Monica and Kamala.It was great to see the chemistry between the cast reflected in the characters and a welcome return of Kamala's family who would quite rightly be along for the ride given their daughter is only a teenager and their love and concern for her safety means they need to be there to support her.The film was visually striking with great space scenes, new planets and a great score by Laura Karpman who gives the heroic trio their own theme.Ignore the haters, go see it!

title: Marvels teady decline continues
text: Hard to express how off the mark this one is.I admit that I didn't watch the Ms Marvel series, because I'm not 10, but her character was just annoying and juvenile.Phase 1-3, including the first Captain Marvel was made with adults, for adults (or big kids), but this could've been on boomerang.Why does every latest Marvel movie or series need a child lead: Antman, Thor, Hawkeye, Captain Marvel? It's destroying the product.The kid is annoying, the story is poor. The trio doesnt work and there's no suspense. The.antagonist is not scary or interesting. The Cat was interesting in the first one, but is overused here.Don't get me started on the Musical interlude. Whoever thought that was a good idea, needs to find a new profession.Brie Larson and Samuel L Jackson had nothing to work with.Even my kids disliked it.

title: The Marvels (MAR) movie review by Most Fair
text: MAR is a superheroes movie featuring Captain Marvel with two additional heroines. This review won't reveal any plot details.The Bad: Where to start? First off, MAR is pure fan exploitation as labeled and licensed by Marvel and Disney. The story is senseless, tasteless and out of any Marvel universe order. The movie main characters are enforced upon the viewer and seem so out of place. It's a chaotic and broken script, plus movie is stuffed with bad CGI. Acting is below mediocre at its best.The Good: Unfortunately, good is not present within MAR.Conclusion: The Disney and Marvel movie campaign fails. Not worth your time.

title: A pleasant fairytale sequel to the first film from the studio MARVEL.
text: Opinion on Â«The Marvels (2023):I'll start with the fact that in March 2019, the first part of Â«Captain MarvelÂ» was released in theaters, and this same year I went and watched it in the theater with my mother, godfather and his sons.At the time, I liked this film, although I still think it's great.I started looking forward to the second part in 2021, and the movie finally hit the big screens.I went and saw this movie in the cinema and what can I say about it?Â«The MarvelsÂ» - is a pleasant fairytale sequel to the first film from the studio MARVEL.It's a great, interesting, light movie to rest and relax.Plot-wise, the film does not present us with anything new, but it was not boring to watch and is quite interesting.The 105-minute running time passed easily, quickly and unnoticed.The graphics and visuals were pretty good and much better than in Â«QuantumaniaÂ».I liked the cast. Brie Larson played well and was very beautiful, as always.Iman Vellani as Kamala and Teyonah Parris as Monica were all good too.Samuel L. Jackson is as good as Nick Fury as usual.The rest of the cast also did well.I liked the soundtrack, but I would like to mention "Intergalactic" by the Beastie Boys and the song "RATATA" by Skrillex, Missy Elliott and Mr. Oizo.As a result, Â«The MarvelsÂ» - is not the best film of the studio MARVEL, but not the worst either.My two-year expectations from the film were met and I do not regret the time spent and the 700 rubles spent on watching this film in the cinema at 3D Format.I give the film an 8.5 - 9 out of 10 and recommend going to the cinema to see it.

title: Garbage
text: This is absolutely the worst mcu movie ever! The story is awful & the storyline is a mess. The directing is lousy & tries way to hard to be to many different things. Thor4 was trash & by far the dumbest movie in the MCU but The Marvels was far worse. Marvel is trying to hard to be everything for everybody, but instead their ending up with shallow simplistic garbage that no one enjoys. Maybe the 5th stage of movies will be an improvement, because if they don't get any better Marvel might be going the way of the dinosaurs. Marvel needs to quit trying to hit it big with the indie directors & go back to one's that understand the heroes & their stories.

title: Jump off or on the handwagon
text: Whoa where do I start the one scene where bilingual came up was pretty interesting. Who green lighted this? Dorothy dandrige? It's cool how they tried to use the kree culture and created a very visually engaged experience.The bad is I am not at liberty to say. There really is no reason either because at some point the criticism is not subjective but objective. At least men are not vilified throughout so that's a plus.I am very upset that I was not able to see this in the theaters, even after purchasing it at home I am still upset about that. I one will change my mind that this was meant to see in the big screen. Oddly enough my wife walked out, and which I thought was ironic.Another con is the special effects, they were kind of lame at some points.In the end, the film was a fun ride. Better than blue Beatle. But as far as marvel comic films go, was pretty lame. Not sure who put this together but you about to lose yo job.

title: The Marvels
text: Captain Marvel (Brie Larson) gets her powers muddled up with Rambeau (Teyonah Parris) and Khan (Iman Vellani) and together they must take on the villain Dar-Benn (Zane Ashton) who is ripping open jump points in the space time continuum to transfer air, water and light to her planet Hala, which was originally messed up by Captain Marvel.Whilst it has the advantage of being lighter and much shorter than your typical MCU blockbuster it also lacks the emotional heft of the earlier films. It is therefore fun to watch at times with some enjoyable and indeed funny moments as well as some imaginative ideas (The Cats - you'll know it when you see it), but it is clearly missing something which includes a plot, which here is decidedly meh.

title: Magic_with_a_kick
text:
Hey everyone, I know what is going on in a a lot of Marvelites' mind, "Is this movie worth watching?" Well, the answer is "YES". I know that a lot of you hate Captain Marvel because of things like;
#Her character Development
#Lack of Emotions
#Female Superhero
#overpowered
#Etc.The first two ones; okay, I agree. But the last ones; no, I don't think that to be a worthy reason to hate her.Talking about the Movie, I was really impressed at their Power switching. It was way too cool. The CGI was better than that of Quantumania. Even though they could have concentrated more on the last part.The outfits of Carol were good(I'm not talking about the superhero costumes). And Prince Yen was amazing. I never thought that I would be able to explore such an aspect of Captain Marvel's life.The villain - Dar-Benn - doesn't worth it. She didn't live up to an antagonist of our minds. Even though she was powerful and had a good motive, She lacked something essential.And the post credits, it gave a new ray of hope to every Marvelites out here(Watch the movie I'm not spoiling it). And I look forward for a Young Avengers team up.Thank you!

title: Not great...and that's putting it nicely.
text: It's five stars for me...and I was feeling charitable. Maybe I am in the minority but I enjoyed "Captain Marvel". Unfortunately, the things that made me enjoy it aren't present in the sequel.The movie is all over the place. Very hard to watch.An overly-convoluted plot - a real hallmark of recent Marvel and DC comic book hero movies, largely to their detriment - with cookie-cutter action. All the action sequences have been done before, and better. There were no major set pieces that really stood out to me.On the acting front: Brie Larson did what she could with what she was given, which wasn't a whole lot, to be honest. Same goes for Samuel L. Jackson as a tired-looking Nick Fury. The rest of the cast were...just bland.Even though "The Marvels" was shorter than your average Marvel film, it was still a huge slog for me.If this is the Marvel standard going forward, they should just stop. Quit while they're only a little bit behind.

title: Absolute rubbish
text: Shocking glammed up Disney twaddle completely ruined the Marvel universe can't say enough bad things about this film turned it off at the musical.If this is the sign of the things to come after being a fan of the books for so many years you can count me out.Why are Disney so intent on glamming things up like a Mary Poppins movie I have no idea who is employing the script writers but they need sacking. I long for another Judge Dredd movie or series or the punisher this type of movie is an insult to Marvel.There is so much material out there producing something like this is disgraceful and unworthy of a Marvel title.

title: Dont bother
text: The Marvels is so poorly conceived and ineptly executed that it not only makes this a front-runner for the dubious honor of worst movie of the MCU but a contender for the worst superhero movie of all time giving "Catwoman" a run for its money.The big things aren't the only aspects where The Marvels fails. There's minimal chemistry among the three leads. The allegedly serious/sentimental moments are mawkish and cringe-worthy. The acting is generally subpar, including that from Brie Larson, an excellent actress except when she puts on her superhero cape. (The lone exception to this is Iman Vellani, who brings a puppy-dog sincerity to her performance.) The fight scenes and special effects-laden sequences are so badly choreographed and edited that it can be difficult to figure out what's going on. And if you want excitement, look elsewhere.In the past couple of years, the MCU has been spinning its wheels with each new entry (excepting Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 3) as creative failure after creative failure has intensified the tailspin. Sadly, The Marvels is the worst of these offenders, elevating the third Ant-Man movie to masterpiece level by comparison. Instead of offering engaging storytelling, it give us flashes, bangs, bad dialogue, and a mountain of fakery (a reminder that things that work in comic books don't always translate to the silver screen). It's sound and fury signifying nothing except to expose another chink in the once-impervious armor of the MCU.

title: Watch this just wanting a small and fun addition.
text: The problem nowadays is that everyone seems to think that every new marvel film is going to be Avengers: Endgame level and absolutely blow your mind. This is more of a short, fun, and chilled out Marvel film, that is actually, in my opinion, levels above the first Captain Marvel film. Ms Marvel is one of the most charismatic MCU characters, and Captain Rambeau and Captain Marvel herself are also a lot better than usual. A Pretty lackluster villain doesn't stop this film from being lighthearted and funny, but not the cringe kind of funny from an MCU film like Love and Thunder. It also has two fantastic post credit scenes. In conclusion, go into this film thinking of it as a more quick and fun MCU film and you'll probably like it as much as I did. Solid MCU addition.

title: Truly terrible
text: Marvel is known for putting out safe, bland, formulaic popcorn flicks that kids love and adults can at least enjoy. They're never anything special, but they're rarely terrible.The Marvels, unfortunately, is truly awful. I don't think we can lay much blame at the feet of the director or stars as the problems are so fundamental to the project itself as to probably make a good version of this impossible.As an example, in a previous MCU film, Captain Marvel (played by Brie Larson) flies through and destroys a giant enemy spaceship. Here, for "plot reasons", she just stands back and watches enemy spaceships (that seem smaller by comparison) do their thing.That gets at the truly fundamental problem with this movie: nothing makes sense except as an excuse to have the plot be a paint-by-numbers MCU film.There's tension between Captain Marvel and Monica Rambeau because someone at the studio thought it would make things more interesting-but good lord, why? It's about Marvel leaving when Rambeau was a child something like thirty years ago. Who cares? What kind of person holds a grudge from when they were twelve?There's about a thousand opportunities and ways they could've defeated the villain well before the ending. Why didn't they? Or why didn't the creators at least come up with something to better explain their impotence?A poorly-conceived animated sequence that goes on way too long. Marvel-style humor that got old about thirty movies ago. People constantly making stupid decisions. Costumes and sets that look straight out of an '80s B-movie. A subplot about the alien cat species that... well, honestly, that part's better than everything else, so maybe I should cut it some slack.This film isn't the failure of the first MCU black director or an all-female lead cast. This film is the failure of Marvel to do anything other than build itself toward more future projects and ignore any kind of storytelling prowess that the people it hires might have. Marvel has backed itself into a corner of milquetoast nothingness, and now it can't even manage to do that right.

title: Awful by all means....
text: So I skipped seeing this in theaters because the trailer looked bad. Well movie finally came out on digital and I gave it a shot. Wow, what a waste of time.1. The chemistry between the three main starts (Monica, Cap Marvel and Ms Marvel) isn't very good. It feels really forced and cheesy. Even with Monica and Cap Marvels connection in the MCU, you didn't really feel the chemistry with Monica as an adult.2. So many scenes were pain to watch as they felt very cheesy or just so dumb that it crossed a line. I nearly stopped when they come across a species of people who don't talk, but sing to communicate. It was like watching a never ending musical. So corny that I nearly turned off the movie.3. The villian was just so boring that you honestly didn't care. They weren't scary, their acting was awful and you found yourself falling asleep when they were on the screen.This movie honestly felt like a made for tv movie, but for maybe preteens or kids. It was cringe and cheesy so often that I lost interest and began looking away from the screen out of bordem. They didn't really fill in much for the characters predicament aside from "OH, you all have the same sort of powers so thus this is why said stuff is happening" Like seriously? Thats it?It's ashame because I enjoyed Captain Marvel (the movie) and I loved Monicas growth from that movie and Wanda Vision. As for Ms Marvel, obviously she is meant to target teen girls more then anyone else. But she is kind of a uninteresting character with kind of lame powers. And her acting wasn't exactly great.Perhaps the only good thing that came out of this movie was the Flurken (alien cat) scene near the end that I won't ruin. It was kinda cute. And of course the mid credit scene was amazing.So would I say to watch this movie? Not really. If you are like me and watch every MCU project to keep up with the story overall, I'd say go look at a synopsis of this movie and save yourself the time. Even at 1 hour and 40+ minutes long, it felt like it wouldn't end. I was already dead inside about 20 minutes in.With the exception of Loki Season 2, MCU just continues to spiral down hill. I felt he only hope at even saving it is the X-Men and Fantastic Four being introduced at some point. VERY painful to sit through, who made this?

title: The good: only 90 minutes; The bad: it's 90 minutes!
text: I enjoyed Captain Marvel a lot. I gave it an 8/10 because it was different and 90s-based. The Marvels was more of the lackluster streak MCU has been on, sadly. I did not care for the two sidekicks, Monica and Kamala, because they acted like children and Captain Marvel was babysitting them. The Kree and Hala people were just there. Nick Fury is a shell of the his original character years ago. Captain Marvel lost her guts and is now bleh and somehow with little motivation to kick butt.The story was non-existent, much like the recent Marvel movies. I did not understand what the heck was the plot. Not familiar with the writer or director of this movie but hope they don't do any more Marvel content.

title: One of the better recent Marvel Films!
text: The Marvels breathes in fresh air into the Marvel Universe and is a fun action adventure that never overstays it's welcome. Director Nia DaCosta does a very good job here with directing her first big budget film after doing such a wonderful job on the latest Candyman movie. The Marvels speeds by with action after action and has a pretty straight forward plot. The chemistry between the 3 Leads here are great. My only complaint is that this movie has a Villian issue and that seems to be the theme for recent Marvel films. Don't listen to all of the online mess about this movie. Go see it for yourself! The Marvels is a fun time and I enjoyed it a lot. The Marvels gets 8 stars out of 10 from me.

title: Embarcingly bad
text: Started watching and 40 minutes into the movie and I still can't tell what's going on. Rough combination of bad acting, lousy script, cheap CGI, and lack of synergy between characters and actors. It just doesn't work. Seriously, I think I've seen movies in the early 2000s with better CGI... It ended being a boring movie and also cringy, it was very hard to watch it. I miss OG marvel movies... This was terrible to watch and to think of all the good movies Marvel used to make, simulating emotion and bringing joy and excitement. This was lacking of it. I wonder what's the future of Marvel. I hope that the Marvels is not part of it.

title: Didn't expected this from MCU!!
text: This movie is kinda different than other MCU movies.. But in order to make it different they kinda made it worse... There are lots of plotholes in the movie. This movie could have been made way better with better writing and story pacing.. Cinematography also looked a bit bad.Although I enjoyed it only little bit. Despite it being a bad movie actors did a great job, we must admit that. Sound works are okay, not great but works...Only best thing about this movie is the credit scenes..Young Avengers were already a matter of discussion in the media. Now they are really bringing it. Hoping it will not be as bad as this movie.. And on the other hand to see Beast after all these years is a treat to our eyes. Waiting for Deadpool 3.. Hopefully we will see a lot of previous X-Men members in the movie.

title: Back to basics MCU
text: Good fun, good humour, and action packed, 'The Marvels' is reminiscent of Phase 1 and 2 MCU so, if you hanker for a bit of of old school Marvel, this is definitely for you! Watching Ms. Marvel beforehand is a must and, as that series is quite good, it's not a big ask. The only negative, for me, was the villain played by Zawe Ashton. I'm not sure if it was the direction, script or acting, but the character didn't quite work for me. That said, James Spader's Ultron had the same effect on first viewing, but improved on subsequent views.Better than recent Marvel efforts (Quantumania and Love and Thunder) and I'm not saying they were terrible; I quite enjoyed them but, on a scale, The Marvels is better.

title: Not even that bad
text: Bro this ain't even that bad... based off of the box office numbers I thought this would be one of the worst 2023 had to offer, but it ain't even that bad. But still definitely not good lol.Almost, if not, all of the emotional beats don't work and a lot of the comedy falls flat but I still did let out a chuckle or two. The movie doesn't take itself too seriously which is a relief and the ms marvel character did not annoy me like I thought she would and was instead actually a pretty great addition. I liked a few of the stylistic choices throughout the film and also liked that they kept the tone fairly light, but when they did try to get deeper into stuff, the scenes just don't work and was unintentionally funny. A lot of the editing felt really clunky but there was a pretty fun montage sequence in the middle. The action throughout was also fairly decent.Nowhere near marvels worst.

title: HUmm

And a film that has no structure has a beginning and has an end the central and non-existent part or better c and
but it's a set of gags of dubious taste and this
second and a problem because you don't make such a good movie. Otherwise the visual effects are good

title: A let down
text: Was looking forward to this one, but it struck out on so many levels. The characters were not cast as strong individuals, but so often weak and silly that it did them (the actors) an injustice. At one point the "comedy" devolved into plain silliness in such a way that it broke the story down, and threatened to change the direction. I kept looking at the clock, wondering how much longer I was going to be able to watch this. I did finish the movie, hoping in some way it could redeem itself. But it didn't. I liked the first Captain Marvel movie where there was a strong character. But this story was weak, diluted, and didn't manage to make me care what would happen in the end.

title: Lots of fun
text:
My son (10) and I enjoyed this movie opening night. It was a lot of fun all the way thru. The three main characters played well off each other, but Miss Marvel was our favorite. She brought so much charm to the movie. And her family was just hilarious to watch deal with MCU craziness. The escape scene was hilarious and the "oh captain my captain" line had me dying with laughter. Also the recruitment scene parodying Fury and Stark was perfection. BTW 23 is totally still a child ðŸ˜„
Really looking forward to the next 2 phases of the MCU. People rating this movie super low just don't know how to have a fun time and should probably get used to grandparent nicknames.

title: Uneven and static - for a force made of LIGHT!
text: This is by far Marvel's most uneven movie. From acting, to script and action it may feed the stomach, but leaves the soul empty.While Marvel has struggled since Endgame, there have been some very good entries. With infinity powerful heroes, something special had to challenge them. So some random. Person with no developed back story or motive is underwhelming.While the acting overall was strong. These are good actors after all. The script was noticeably shocking. While Marvel has recently embraced the 'silly', it is poorly contrasted with sharp moments the attempted to be emotional and forced moments of drama.While the action is fine, the 'shtick' of their power switching is so forced and has no impact on the plot, character development and lends no lasting impact. More like the soft buzz of a fly in the background you find obnoxious than the the loud roar of creativity.This movie has all the hallmarks of an NFL team, down by 21 with 3 minutes left throwing a crazy 50 yard touchdown to make it a 14 point game... Cool in the moment, but overall utterly insignificant.5/10.

title: Just watched the marvels
text: By far the worst MCU movie. Absolutely terrible film. None of the characters expect for nick fury are remotely interesting the villain is the worst marvel villain yet and is defeated in such a dumb dull way. It's a good thing this movie is short because the second it started I just wanted it to end. Now the worst scene in the film and maybe the entire franchise is when they go to a planet were everyone communicates through song... not going to lie I was so close to walking out the cinema. The ending of this film is interesting but there's no context to it whatsoever until the actual scene plays out.

title: Expands on Captain Marvel's predecessor
text: Teyonah Parris as Monica Rambeau, Iman Vellani as Kamala Khan, and Brie Larson as Carol Danvers star in DaCosta's picture. The three characters' genuine friendship makes for a lively and engaging encounter.The Marvels expands on Captain Marvel's predecessor by delving deeper into themes of sisterhood and interplanetary reliance. Written by DaCosta, Karasik, and McDonnell, the movie delves into the intricate geopolitical and familial underpinnings of Captain Marvel, striving to transcend existentialism.The plot of The Marvels has some sudden endings and dropped connections, making it rather perplexing. The narrative starts in Jersey City with a missing bangle discovered by a Kree named Dar-Benn. Wearing it, Kamala, the young protagonist of Ms. Marvel, works on her fan writing about Captain Marvel.DaCosta's choreography and visual aesthetic are highlighted in The Marvels through a storyline centered on the acquisition of Dar-Benn, Kamala's connection with Carol and Monica, and their use of their powers. A vÃ©ritÃ© technique reminiscent of Candyman and angular shifts are used to create the intimate mood of the picture.Joined by destiny, Carol, Monica, and Kamala have to stop Dar-Benn's scheme from happening to the cosmos. When it comes to their task, the stakes are not as high as they may be. The length of time it takes to learn Dar-Benn's motivations and the way that plot point is dropped in favor of a neat resolution are two issues with The Marvels.The bond between Captain Marvel, Carol, and Kamala is depicted in The Marvels. With Goose and Fury, Captain Marvel leads a solitary existence, as Carol works to piece together her past. Carol falls toward weakness and loses her steeliness as their interconnecting talents require regular engagement.Khan shows herself to be the key to this dynamic trio's success as the three ladies battle to save their galaxy. She encourages Carol to loosen up and assists Monica in brainstorming. She is unquestionably fierce, and if Disney and Marvel are astute, she will lead the franchise into the future.

title: vintage Marvel finesse
text: Superhero fatigue is real. It settles in less like a malaise to be shaken off and overcome, and more like a dawning realization that alas, dear friends, the novelty of bringing our dearest comic books to live action has worn off. So... That's it, then. It's over. Or...! In the exultant and exuberant tone of one Shang Chi: or...! Or, the genre- just like any genre- can evolve, and in the capable hands of Nia De Costa and her eminently winsome ensemble, that certainly seems the case. "The Marvels" is a brisk, breezy, offbeat and quirky production which utilizes the MCU's most potent, albeit double-edged, sword: its sheer preponderance of material. Walking the trapeze of the double edge is no small feat: when does that preponderance become rote? When does the homework necessary to even understand the movie become onerous? When does it become nonsensical and thus senseless? Only time will tell if the numerous elements in the current Marvel Universe can be arranged into a coherent symphony with all its off-tempo beats and off-key notes. "The Marvels" has succeeded for the moment with its sincerity, its energy, and its audacity. The movie is legitimately a dynamic wriggling living thing, grasping earnestly for a future while all the while recognizing the immense tradition behind it. And so it begins... again...!

title: Cars 2 of the MCU
text: What cars 2 is to Pixar, The Marvels is to the MCU. Captain Marvel was, arguably, the weakest MCU addition at the time of its release. The sequel is much much worse.The Marvels feel like one of the cheaper Disney+ TV shows stitch together to the length of a movie. Everything about it is subpar - cringe dialogues, terrible CGI, infantile script. The movie is all over the place to the point, that it feels like bunch of 12 year old boys stitch up the plot together on one of their afternoon play dates.After Quantumania, Love and Thunder and now this, MCU seems to be heading in the same direction as the F&F series. Disney should stop focusing on forced diversity and start saving its most valuable IP.

title: Bland performances & poor attention to detail
text: While the best part of the movie is its shortened length, the movie itself suffers from lack of attention to detail. It feels as if the director had no clue how to make a "believable" sci fi fantasy movie.Battle scenes lack continuity, while one persons attack can render total destruction while the same attack barely knocks someone off their feet. The ladies never really hit each other and their hair is always perfect after a scramble, and not one scratch on their pretty faces???The relationship aspects of the film felt disingenuous and forced. There is just too many instances of the movie that leave you scratching your head and asking yourself, why did they put that in the movie?With that said, it wasn't as horrible as I expected, It was just poorly directed which resulted in subpar acting performances.

title: A decent experience
text: Marvel has had one of the most successful journeys for a very long period of time. Captain Marvel was one of the characters which have high expectations from the public. She was known to stand against the Mad Titan and now she doesn't seem that strong. The casting was good but the movie could have been better. We are seeing the same stuff in different faces over and over again. This needs to evolve and new story lines must be explored. I personally think Ms Marvel is the character that kept the movie together with her fun and excitement, otherwise it would have gone even lower. Yes not every film will be 'Infinity War' like but atleast it needs to be a little better than what this was.

title: Even better
text: Excellent sequel to the first. Well paced and a lot of surprises. They better do more Captain Marvel and soon. The growth of all the characters worked well here. I enjoyed that the audio was actually at a good level and you could hear what was being said. The movie was the right length to tell the story they wanted to tell. I would have liked to see more interaction between those three but they had to tell a lot without lecturing or using a lot of flashbacks. I did catch something that no on else has or is talking about. There was one other thing that needed answering that wasn't covered that isn't a plot hole just something that needed to be covered.

title: Surprisingly Good!
text: I've been a Marvel fan for many years now so was really excited when the next Marvel movie came out. In saying that, I feel the last few Marvel movies haven't been up to par so was a little hesitant to watch The Marvels to avoid disappointment. But I was pleasantly surprised though how good this movie was!I Highly recommend watching The Marvels. It's funny, cleaver and the action scenes are incredible. It's definitely better than the first movie.Brie Larson is amazing as usual, Teyonah Parris is a bad ass and Iman Vellani is so damn funny.Please put your biased opinions aside and watch this movie! Trust me it's worth it.

title: An Enjoyable Movie
text: I truly enjoyed this film. The chemistry between the Marvels is so good and the action scenes are chefs kiss. It's not perfect. The villain is a little flat and uninteresting but it's not so bad as to be annoying. The comedic relief is perfectly placed and does not overwhelm the viewer.Brie Larson seems much more comfortable in her role as captain marvel this go round and it's fun to watch. Though, Iman Vellani steals the show as Ms. Marvel.Overall I truly loved this movie and would be happy to spend my money to see it again. Take your family to see this even if you haven't seen the tv shows. I think you can still understand the movie. 8/10 stars.

title: Such a fun movie, you forget it's only 90 minutes!
text: With a minor recap at the start for those who haven't kept up with the marvel TV shows, the movie all but hits the ground running with lots of action and laughs.Ms. Marvel truly steals the show, and truly looks like she's having a blast filming the whole movie.Even with a "musical" number, the movie never really feels like it 'jumps the shark' and feels like something pulled right from the pages of a marvel comic.While the villains actions aren't really well thought out, and ultimately will remain a forgotten marvel movie baddie, the actress did a great job going toe to toe with the 3 leads.And with a mid credits scene to blast open the multiverse, this movie is a great bit of fun for the entire marvel family.

title: Great Fun Movie, Just The Right Length
text: I went with high expectations, because I disregard and reviews or opinions of MCU nerds. I was not disappointed. I saw it an an IMAX, but in 2D, and the visuals certainly justified that choice.The story was good, better than the last few movies, the main cast were a delight to see; I had specifically watched Ms Marvel a few days before viewing this movie, and I'm glad I did; I may even go back and try Hawkeye once more.The humour was perfect, and Sam Jackson was often at the centre of the humour and story, as he should be. The concept of Nick Fury heavily interacting with Kamala's family (Mrs K calls him "Nicholas") was my favourite part.There's a mid credit scene, which superb, but no end credit scene (I sat in an empty cinema waiting for it!)Just enjoy, it's fun.

title: This was so much fun!
text: Higher, Further, Faster, together!I really enjoyed watching Marvels, a action-packed film that showcases the power and diversity of three amazing superheroes. The film is a sequel to Captain Marvel and a continuation of the TV shows WandaVision and Ms. Marvel, but it also stands on its own as a captivating and original story.The film follows Carol Danvers, Monica Rambeau, and Kamala Khan as they discover that their powers are mysteriously linked and they start swapping places with each other every time they use them. This leads them to uncover a plot by the Kree, who are waging a civil war on their home planet and seeking to exploit the Quantum Bands, a powerful artifact that Kamala possesses.....The film is directed by Nia DaCosta, who creates stunning visuals and dynamic action sequences that keep the audience on the edge of their seats. She also balances the humor and drama of the film, giving each character a distinct personality and voice. The film also features a diverse and talented cast, led by Brie Larson as Carol Danvers, Teyonah Parris as Monica Rambeau, and Iman Vellani as Kamala Khan (from that great Disney plus series!). They have great chemistry, and they portray their characters with depth and nuance.The Marvels is a must-see film for Marvel fans and anyone who loves a good adventure. It is a celebration of female empowerment and a testament to the power of teamwork. It is one of the best films of 2023 and a worthy addition to the Marvel Cinematic Universe. I give it a 09 out of 10 and I highly recommend it to anyone who wants to have an actual FUN time at the movies (remember fun?!)

title: One of the best MCU films, despite what you might hear
text: I had read the dreadful reviews. Then I remembered the terrible reviews given to Captain Marvel and Ms. Marvel, and figured it was worth giving it a shot -- especially since it appeared to mean more Goose.I'm very glad I did.It felt like a movie about superheroes-as-people, dealing with the consequences of their actions, rather than crossover gimmicks like Avengers: Infinity War, which I literally walked out of three times, due to the sheer amount of stupid on display, from characters and from writers.This movie finds the humor when it fits, the pathos when it fits, and the fight scenes -- which could easily have been a complete nightmare, given the character-switching -- actually made sense, even when at their most complicated.Was it brilliantly acted? Not really, though Iman Vellani did very well -- but there have only been a few brilliant acting performances in the MCU as a whole, and they overwhelmingly involved two actors, now both out of the MCU, so...I would recommend it, unless your demands of a superhero movie involve being mostly fights and a hero who's male.

title: Fast paced but yet super funny
text: The Marvels was a huge surprise for me! I walked into this one with extremely low expectations. It was extremely hilarious especially with Ms Marvel.The Good: I personally thought the pacing in the film was really good. The action was very well done especially during the first act. It was also the funniest mcu film in a while. It was funnier than Thor Love and Thunder in every way. Ms. Marvel absolutely stole the show for me.The Bad: the only problem with the film was probably how poorly the villain was written in this film.I don't think this movie was perfect but it was very enjoyable and funny. I would go see it again.8.5/10.

title: Loved it!
text: Amazing movie! I loved seeing the three of them together, their chemistry is amazing! Kamala definitely represents the marvel fans, and her not only meeting her hero but joining her is likely a wish of a lot of marvel super fans. We also find out a little more backstory on Monica and Carol's relationship and why Monica seemed not too supportive of her in Wandavision. Captain Marvel is given more opportunity to show her more human self as opposed to the constant super hero which is great. Also the Flerken is definitely a favorite, who can't refuse a cute little fur all that could devour you whole!

title: Fantastic
text: Really enjoyed this! It was lots of fun, a fast paced movie with some laughs and serious parts too. I love the cats and love Brie Larson as Captain Marvel. Monica's backstory seemed a bit random and there probably should have been more of a story to her powers, they seemed to just come out of nowhere. Otherwise she was fantastic and they were great working together. I'll be interested to see what Kamala gets up to in the future and whether we will be seeing much of Captain Marvel after this. Don't listen to the picky reviewers, it is supposed to be fun and a little bit less serious just like Thor Love and Thunder.

title: Excellent and funny
text: Loved the story really felt it developed the characters and moved the entire MCU multiverse forward in a coherent and intelligent manner. Loved the character arcs thought they added depth to each person and the family scenes were hilarious and so true to family dynamics and back story fill ins were useful and sensibly written as well as meaningful and sensitive. Overall would recommend have not enjoyed a Marvel in the cinema since End Game and I've seen all of them, this one I loved and left the cinema with a real buzz thinking about the follow up movies, can't wait to see the next generation of powerful and heroic women ðŸ‘ðŸ»

title: I don't think I've ever laughed so hard at a film
text: Amazing director, jokes were fast paced and didn't have those cheeky long pauses after, it just moved on. Love that they didn't drag the movie on to be 2 hours, it was just enough and didn't waste any time.This was a whole new fun side of Fury which felt back like Fury we haven't seen on the screen. New life was brought to the character. (Especially after secret wars which was disappointing). Fury was hilarious and dropped a bunch of great one-liners. I cannot emphasize enough how excellent the editing was with the comedic timing.I've read a bunch of Ms. Marvel comics and it's been beautiful watching these three ladies evolve into their characters on screen. Her family was actually relevant to the story and and just like the comics, her mom and brother were hilarious. This was amazing and I'm planning to back to see it again in theater's.

title: Great fun and enjoyable characters
text: I loved seeing the three leads come together. I rewatched Ms Marvel in preparation and loved it and really enjoyed seeing Kamala Khan interact with the others (Iman Vellani is brilliant, so are the others). I think you can still see this and enjoy it without having seen Ms Marvel, or WandaVision.This was its own story but had a couple of brief but fun cameos linking it to the wider MCU.I enjoyed the humour and the action, it was great to see Kamala's family, but my favourite part was the interaction between the 3 leads and their dynamic. It also touched on the fact that even though some people idolise Captain Marvel, she's not perfect.Another thing I want to highlight is one of the planets they go to - it really feels like the culture is unique and well thought-out (along with their unique language style). Often films where they go to different planets, the planet feels just like earth but the people have purple skin or something, whereas this really felt like a different culture.My main criticism is that a couple of bits near the end weren't explained fully leaving me slightly confused, and also that I would have liked the film to be longer and to see more of the characters. But apart from that I really enjoyed it!Oh, and the mid-credits scene made me feel very excited for what's to come next!

title: Absolutely Fantastic Time
text: This movie was so much fun! Lighthearted and enjoyable like my favorite MCU movies, I felt that it had excellent pacing, action, and even the acting was above par for a comic book movie. Seeing it in the theater, I felt the same as when I saw Guardians of the Galaxy and Ant-Man, back when the MCU was new(-ish): the feeling that this was exactly what comic book movies should be, and that someone finally found all the fun that lesser movies had chosen not to include.I've been burnt out on the MCU but went to see this anyway, and I'm glad I did. It has a consistently fun atmosphere and many jokes that are impeccably written and delivered. The premise is silly, the science fiction is hand-waved away, and the characters are dropped into unusual situations to act like themselves for better or worse - all exactly as a comic book movie should be, in my opinion.Punctuating the movie's jovial tone, there are a few scenes that highlight the emotional connections between the characters and themes involving knowing who we are, balancing our personal and familial responsibilities, and letting others see our true selves even when we're not at our best... and none of them were long enough to derail the fun I was having.Like Guardians, Thor: Ragnarok, and the Spider-Verse, this is exactly what I want a comic book movie to be.

title: Great MCU film!
text: I don't understand all the hate, but I guess the last Captain Marvel movie got similar hate, which is disappointing.I thought this film was great. Good pacing, great chemistry between the three leads, especially considering this is the first movie they've been together in. Also loved a MCU movie with female leads.The story itself was classic MCU. Bad guy out to destroy the universe, super heroes work together to save it. Incredibly funny scenes ('Memories' was definitely up there - hilarious!). Moved the MCU along too - especially with the mid-credits scene (so good!! I pissed off the people next to me with my nerd excitement).I'm not going to lie - I had seen some reviews before going and had low expectations. But I'm very happy this movie completely blew my expectations. Really good night out.

title: It should be enough I think
text: I was in deed surprised but this film, that I wasn't interested in beforehand, and was a very pleasant experience. I was entertained and was satisfied with the experience I received. To me the characters were based and had depth that I was lacking before. They have pain and motivation as well. There were some moments where it felt cringe a little to my taste but previously I had more of the same feeling so here I just let it go, not everything should be for my best taste and I came to see this film to have fun and so I had. I was even at first touched that I was watching a movie that it's even okay if I won't like this story that much, it still will have an impact for other characters that I am interested in.I recommend it to every Marvel fan.

title: Fun as the Marvels and Comics of superhero need to be
text: I was really enjoying this movie, the girls bring fun and fresh interaction, like known friends, there's so much chemistry between them, and glad the comical relief thaht this movie brings, The effects, the plot, as simple they are, it was well done. I do not ever understand the hate towards Brie Larson , such a great actress diminish with no reason. The portraid of Carol Denvers fits her like a Glove, as well with Monica and Maria Rambea, and to Kamala. Great grup, wonder how they're gonna mixed with the others plots in this great multi universe created. This movies are for fans and to be entertained, we need more, and we need to know more.

title: This was better than expected
text: This was actually a really fun movie and the chemistry between the ladies were really fun to watch. The movie had the right amount of drama, comedy and the right amount of action, especially the switching scene at the first act, and the characters really brought this movie to life, even though the story was weak, and the villain was even weaker.The character of Miss Marvel played by Iman was truly fun to watch. She was funny, and she was dramatic.Brie Larson did not over act or do too much in this movie, which actually was kind of good for her, because she took the focus from her main character and give it to the other characters and side characters.And this movie is definitely going to be a fan favorite for cat lovers.

title: Energetic and Fun, actually!
text: So many reviews complain, and yeah.. this isn't Infinity War, and yeah, this has an entire different feel than Iron Man. This movie has pretty non-stop energy, and it's clearly intended for Fun and a little warmth and humor. I liked Samuel Jackson much more here than in the silly little Secret Invasion.And yeah... Development and deep Character exploration is light to non-existent. This is not your "Thinking Man's" movie. (and clearly not a "Man's" movie at all, but still great for guys!) So if you want to think, and explore deep character motivations, the other reviews are right.. wait for streaming. If you want a fun, engaging movie, I rate this one better than the ending 90 minutes of Barbie (the first few minutes of Barbie were so good.. ..then.. plop)The only thing on the downside for me is the kind of emotionless style of Brie Larson, but she does play the super-est hero in a similar way other actors have portrayed Superman... stoic, a little wooden, but super powerful. I wish we could see her having as much fun as Iman Vellani! Her few moments of warmth and emotion were great to see.Speaking of Iman Vellani, I think compared to the Infinity War Spiderman, she has a way to go, but her performance is still fun to watch, and always seems sincere and real.We saw the movie with the teen girls, and they all thought it was awesome. If you want to be engaged and entertained for 90 minutes, this is probably the best option available over the last few months!

title: superhero barbies
text: The marvel is really a good movies the direction is good so are the performances , its short and sweet.The movie starts on a great note set up darr benn as a promising mcu villan the chemistry between the cast is the best part of the movie iman vellani as kamala khan is one of the best superhero casting in the mcu brie larson as captain marvel shines once again while with a very short screen time the khan family definetly left a mark in the moviebut the screenplay could have been better and addition of 10 to 15 mins in runtime would have provided a better character depth in the movie.Stay for the post credits.

title: If you liked Ragnarok you must see this movie
text: This movie executed what Love and Thunder wasn't able to fulfill. The action starts this movie out strong then you start to understand the characters very quickly, given you haven't seen any material leading up to this film. There is just enough comedic relief to break up the fight sequences and the comedy is lighthearted and not over the top. Sure the CGI could have used a little more effort when it comes to Flurken stuff but the fighting is fantastic and well practiced. The villain of the film is wonderful, a character that is misunderstood-classic villain material. All 3 leads of the movie had great energy and on screen chemistry. It felt like they were real people. Brie Larson has gotten slack in the past for her portrayal of Captain Marvel and she is here in this movie to prove everybody wrong and to tell the world that she was made for this role. This movie has a short run time but it gets to the point and doesn't draw out scenes, it doesn't feel rushed at all. Overall a great movie for all ages and is very inclusive.

title: Marvellous entertainment and a very fun movie
text: This movie has everything going against it. Strikes, unknown director, superhero fatigue, and perhaps most notably is the MCUs track record lately which has been abysmal.But oh my lord this is so much fun watch.There are 3 negatives: I can think of is that it is too short. This movie flies by with stunning entertainment from first second to last, and the "short" run-time makes it fly by even faster. The second negative is that this feels a bit too goofy and too Marvel at times. The first Movie was much better, and felt more original, and more true to the character of Captain Marvel. The third negative is a few misses in the dialogue, but I also think that goes together with the short run time.The good with this movie is basically everything else. The directing (which I was very hesitant about) was good, the acting one of the best in any Marvel production, the music and sound design is masterful, and the entertainment goes through the roof into the stratosphere. Perhaps the most entertaining Marvel movie of all time. Not the best, the movie is more average Marvel-wise, but this is a very fun movie.From the movie theatre I was in, everyone came out with a big smile on their face. The only other time I have seen so many smiling faces leaving the movie theatre was after the first Deadpool.A very strong 8/10, I am almost inclined to give this a 9 but this is not as good as the first movie (which I really love) and there are a few misses that reduces the score. Still great fun and very entertaining. A most watch.

title: I loved it!
text: The Marvels was great! Hilarious! Laughed so hard! I watched it in 2D unfortunately, I can't imagine how great it is in 3D.Goose made a performance on his own, what a character!! Also, BRIE Larson was born to be Captain Marvel.I will always miss the Avengers and Guardians of the galaxy and I hope I will see them again. But, we are heading to a new phase and I will always support my superheroes. I can't understand all the hate about Brie and the Marvels.Don't forget that Captain Marvel once saved our Iron Man. She rocks!Keep going Marvel. We demand more movies like this one.Post-credit scene was fire!!!!

title: Not Endgame, but a Fun game
text: So much has already been written about this film so I went in with an open mind. Is it the best Marvel film, no. Is it the worst marvel film, no. This is a great fun film and it has its own audience. As a marvel fan and a dad of a teenage daughter, this is the audience.As an MCU fan who can just enjoy the characters in their own contained story, i liked it. For my daughter who thought Marvel was for boys, to see an all girl group, she's been converted. She liked the banter, the action, and the Flirkins. I loved that she loved it. So for me this is an 8/10.It's not moving the MCU forward in some long story arc, the villain is good but not a level boss, and the threat never felt too real. But it was FUN. Remember that; when MCU was just fun and not bogged down with excessive expectation or to be part of some multiversal annhilation build up. This is popcorn.I've read some really hateful reviews and it feels unjustified. The movie had pace, good action, some great set peices, great designs, wardrobes, music. Each character has a bit of an arc, leaving the movie further forward than at the start. The movie dared to have a Cinderella musical moment and an invasion of cats. Love it for what it is, a fun light hearted chapter of the MCU.

title: Not the greatest Marvel movie of all time but that doesn't mean it was bad!
text: I came into the movie with very low expectations. Expectations were quickly exceeded. Captain Marvel, WandaVision, and Ms. Marvel were average that had their good moments. This movie was better than those shows. Plot was decent. Nothing revealing about the future movies, in particular Kang the Conquer. Had some good action sequences and unexpected humor with the 'cats'. I think Brie Larsen redeemed herself as an actress slightly with this movie. Slight spoiler here: Stay for the mid credit scene. It will be interesting to see how X-Men and Marvel collaborate together. It seems this is the direction we're heading with Deadpool 3 involving Hugh Jackman. It was everything I expected from a Marvel movie.

title: Really fun and joy filled movie
text: I really enjoyed this movie. I love Brie Larson as Captain Marvel and wish we saw more of her in the MCU. Teyonah Parris as Monica Rambeau and Iman Vellani as Mrs. Marvel both got to really shine here. SLJ as Nick Fury also got a lot of spotlight here in the movie.Tons of character growth, laugh out loud moments, cool fight scenes, what more can you want from an movie?It was fun, it was cute, and it was really joyful. I truly loved this movie.My wife and kids joined me and I asked what each of them thought. My wife also loved it. My two daughters, 9 and 5, really enjoyed it as well. Go see it. You'll like it.

title: The Marvels is amazingly crazy and a blast of a film
text: This is such an amazingly crazy blast of a movie, by no means perfect, The Marvels provides an entertaining narrative that will endear you to the characters new and old. Don't let the runtime fool you, this movie is packed in a very good way. The cinematography in the opening sequences particularly stands out as a technical highlight as well as the new Marvels score. Iman Vellani shines in her stand-out role and it is apparent she is having the time of her life, particularly in the final scene of the film. The film's pacing is inconsistent at times but only pulls you out of the moment for a few moments. The villain is sadly underdeveloped and I wish there was more motivation fleshed out but that is made up by the leads' wonderful chemistry and dynamic together. No doubt about it, this movie had me leaving the theater wanting more from these three characters together. I believe it makes a fine entry as the 33rd film in the Marvel Cinematic Universe and gives you some phase 1 level, all-time Marvel scenes hinting at the future of the MCU. While keeping these scenes from overshadowing the movie as a whole. It's a story that is part of a larger universe, and nothing felt like the scene was at the expense of the story of this movie. This film is an absolute Marvel, see it in theaters.

title: "The Marvels" Review
text:
This movie wasn't great not even close to a ten but its score is totally unfair. For context other MCU movies that have better scores and are not near as good as this one.Shang Chi
Black Widow
Doctor Strange and the multiverse of madness
Eternals!!!!!?????The movie wasn't great just a stepping stone for the introduction of Kamala Khan and Monica Rambeau.The story was generic and not very interesting but it was entertaining and funny.I love Iman Vellani she is very funny and silly a breath of fresh air for the Marvel universe with stuck up actors who aren't funny at all (Ruffalo I'm talking to you)I think a fair evaluation would be 6.5 to 7 at least. Also what are you expecting in a Marvel movie if it's not silly jokes and a ok plot just to hang out at the cinema.Get real people is a Marvel movie, lighten up or start to change your scores for all of the marvel movies. Besides the first Iron man The hulk an some Spider-Man movies the rest are not a cinematic masterpiece worthy of the scores they get.

title: Hey, I liked it. Not 10/10 but still pretty good.
text: I went to see The Marvels yesterday. I enjoyed it. And IMO it developed Carol Danvers' character significantly. The writing for both Monica Rambeau and Kamala Khan felt... compressed, and their origins seemed a bit "glossed over".While I am glad this wasn't a three hour movie - there is only so much you can pack into a 1 hour, 45 minute movie. It could have been a little longer if just to give these two characters a little more time to talk with each other about their early experiences. And maybe a little less time spent in the "training montage" sequence with the flashy CGI effects.I loved how Iman Vellani (playing Kamala Khan) pulled off the "I talk way too much while fangirling" character. It seemed quite believably acted and not forced.IMO it's at least as good as Black Widow was, and will likely be more entertaining for many.I give it a solid 8 out of 10 for the MCU movies.

title: Fun, enjoyable Family Flick
text: Lot of fun action, great seeing an effective team of Heroes working together. Villain was clearly a sociopath and her goals were clear.Movie has some cheesiness but come on it is based off Comics! The Flerkens in force were especially hilarious. The Planet of Song was pretty funny as well.If you want a fun family safe action movie this one is an excellent choice all 6 of us that went came out of the Theater happy we had gone and looking forward to watch again.Ignore the people complaining they seem to have forgotten how to be happy with a movie. Covid seems to have turned a lot of folks into Edgelord know it alls who really need to learn how to find something positive to say.

title: An enjoyable romp
text: Thoroughly enjoyed this romp through the universe, exactly as advertised. Characters were well drawn and performances believable, cameos fun, SFX serviceable, stunts / choreography well executed.I got what I expected, not a big thinker movie, but a fun filled experience (although the Mum character is a bit annoying).Whilst Brie Larson is the headline act, most characters get ample screen time and opportunity to shine.Ms Marvel was a fun little series and it would have been nice to see a little more of her quirky character in this movie.Marvel movies don't have to be gritty, dark, overly violent, following a 5 year story arc over 10 to 15 movies. These standalone episodes can be a fun little aside. I think Stan Lee would agree. Marvel to the core :)

title: A Cosmic Triumph in the MCU
text: In the vast galaxy of superhero cinema, "The Marvels" emerges as a celestial spectacle that soars to new heights, propelled by stellar performances and cutting-edge visual effects that redefine the cosmic boundaries of the Marvel Cinematic Universe (MCU). As a cosmic crescendo, the film achieves greatness akin to the cinematic classics, standing shoulder to shoulder with the illustrious likes of "The Godfather" and "The Dark Knight."The true magic of "The Marvels" lies in the electric chemistry of its triumphant trio - Brie Larson, Teyonah Parris, and Iman Vellani. Their performances are nothing short of extraordinary, weaving a tapestry of characters that transcends the typical superhero narrative. Larson's portrayal of Captain Marvel exudes a commanding presence, seamlessly blending strength and vulnerability. Parris delivers a tour de force performance, capturing the essence of Monica Rambeau with unparalleled authenticity. Vellani, in her breakout role as Ms. Marvel, brings an infectious enthusiasm that injects a fresh burst of energy into the MCU.The synergy between Larson, Parris, and Vellani is a magnetic force that propels the narrative forward, creating a dynamic trio reminiscent of cinema's legendary ensembles. Their on-screen camaraderie elevates "The Marvels" beyond the standard superhero fare, forging a connection with the audience that is both profound and enduring.Visually, "The Marvels" stands as a testament to the advancements in filmmaking technology. The cutting-edge visual effects are nothing short of breathtaking, painting the cosmos with vibrant hues and dazzling displays of power. Each frame is a masterpiece, a cosmic ballet that pushes the boundaries of what we thought possible in the superhero genre. In this visual symphony, the audience is treated to a sensory feast that rivals the most iconic moments in cinematic history.While some critics may nitpick at the pacing and the nature of the antagonist, it's essential to view these elements as deliberate choices that add depth to the narrative. The measured pacing allows for character development and emotional resonance, akin to the deliberate pacing of a classic masterpiece. The enigmatic nature of the villain, far from being a flaw, adds an air of mystery and unpredictability, inviting audiences to delve deeper into the MCU's cosmic tapestry.In conclusion, "The Marvels" transcends the confines of a mere superhero film, catapulting itself into the pantheon of cinematic greatness. The electric performances of Larson, Parris, and Vellani, coupled with cutting-edge visual effects, create a cosmic opera that resonates with the timeless quality of cinema's finest. As the MCU continues to evolve, "The Marvels" serves as a celestial beacon, guiding the franchise into uncharted and exhilarating territories.

title: Don't listen to the haters.
text: I watched this movie just yesterday and omg it's so good. I don't care what people say, I liked it and it's not as bad as people make it out to be. Obviously not the best but for me an 8/10 is pretty darn good. I'm sick of the marvel fans to be honest, I'm gonna watch things for myself. I feel as if people just think it's some sort of trend to just hate on marvel now, some yeah but why the marvels?
