Stop comparing the new marvel to the old and expecting some avengers endgame level event, cause this ain't it, it's building up just like phase one was. When I went there was only 10 people in the theatre, quite disappointing. So please if you're wondering if this is worth it, it is, it's a nice fun family movie that is funny at times and shocking, the credit scene got me excited!!! So please don't join the hate train and just try this out.

title: Love the performances
text: "The Marvels" is an exhilarating cinematic experience that seamlessly weaves together the talents of its lead actresses, creating a dynamic and captivating superhero film. Brie Larson, reprising her role as Carol Danvers, brings a commanding presence to the screen. Her portrayal of Captain Marvel is a perfect blend of strength and vulnerability, showcasing the character's evolution with depth and authenticity. Larson's on-screen charisma radiates, anchoring the film with a compelling performance that captivates audiences from start to finish.Joining Larson is Teyonah Parris, who delivers a standout performance as Monica Rambeau. Parris brings a refreshing energy to the narrative, infusing Monica with resilience and determination. Her character's journey is both empowering and relatable, and Parris navigates it with grace and conviction. The on-screen chemistry between Larson and Parris adds an extra layer of authenticity to the film, enhancing the overall viewing experience.Introducing us to the enigmatic character of Kamala Khan is Iman Vellani, whose performance is nothing short of delightful. Vellani's portrayal of Ms. Marvel is filled with infectious enthusiasm and youthful exuberance. She effortlessly captures the essence of a young hero discovering her powers and navigating the challenges that come with them. Vellani's charisma and charm make Kamala Khan a character that audiences will undoubtedly root for.Together, Larson, Parris, and Vellani form a dynamic trio that elevates "The Marvels" to new heights. The film not only celebrates the strength and complexity of its female characters but also highlights the diverse talents of these three actresses. The synergy between their performances creates a powerful on-screen presence that is both empowering and entertaining.In addition to the stellar performances, "The Marvels" boasts impressive visuals, a compelling storyline, and a perfect blend of action and emotion. The film successfully expands the Marvel Cinematic Universe, offering fans a fresh and exciting chapter while paying homage to its comic book roots.In conclusion, "The Marvels" is a triumph, and the lead actresses-Brie Larson, Teyonah Parris, and Iman Vellani-shine brightly, each bringing a unique and essential element to the film. Their performances, coupled with the film's overall excellence, make "The Marvels" a must-watch for fans of superhero cinema and anyone who appreciates a thrilling and well-crafted cinematic experience.

title: Higher, further, faster, together!!
text: So I've been a huge fan of Captain Marvel since her first movie and I was so looking forward to see her teaming up with Monica Rambeau and Kamala Khan as I love the two characters from the Disney+ shows; Monica in WandaVision and Kamala from Ms Marvel.From the beginning, the movie was entertaining and a joy to watch. Each of the three protagonists looked like they had fun playing their roles. Brie Larson gave a great performance now that she's settled in playing Carol and for those of who weren't too keen on the character from the first film may find her a lot better in this sequel (quick side note, I've been a Brie Larson Stan since the trolls tried to destroy the film and make up fake news about her).It was great seeing Teyonah Parris back as a superpowered Monica Rambeau and she had great comedic timing. However the standout performance was Iman Vellani as Kamala Khan a.k.a Ms Marvel. When she finally meets her hero and idolises her, it reminds me the way Tom Holland's Peter Parker admirers and looks up to Tony Stark.The fight choreography was cleverly done such as one scene where it took a place in the Khan household and how the character's must learn to switch places in order to work together to defeat the villain Dar-Benn.My only few criticisms I have for the film is that it was one of the Marvel movies that had a short runtime and because I was having fun watching it, I didn't want it to end and it went by so quickly. Another critique is the villain was a bit bland. Zawe Ashton gave it her all, but she's one of the weakest baddies in the franchise. Her motivations were explained but felt rushed. Also seeing baby kitten flerkens were so cute!!Overall, the movie is fun, action packed and in my opinion, just the film we need in all the superhero fatigue that is being talked about. I would rank it up in my top 20. Plus stay for the post credit scene! I was screaming in the theatre, lolðŸ˜‚ Can't wait to see the film again.Higher Further Faster!!!

title: Team Flerkin
text: I heard a lot of bad stuff about the movie withing the 48hr before seeing, but there was no way we were not going to see all the cuteness.After seeing it, not a bad thing I heard about it was found in the movie. The villain was great. Maybe people didn't like how cute she was?All the story, characters, and fight scenes seemed polished to a T. If anything it was a tad too short. They pretty much had to make everything to a T because there isn't much down time or time to take things in. Its packed with action to the point the characterization had to happen fast when they really could have taken a little more time in areas so people who hadn't watched all the other material didn't feel lost. This is especially noticeable with the prince whoes world has never been seen in the Marvel movies before.

title: A Fun Time, Some Flaws But Not Enough to Ruin the Movie.
text: "The Marvels" is a fun time and I really enjoyed it. Is it perfect? No.There are some weak points, like Aladna. I feel they could've opted for a better execution of the "language" so it didn't seem so bad cringe instead of the intended funny awkward cringe. (But it by no means is significant enough that it ruins the movie, just more of a "They could've done it better.") I'm not gonna elaborate because it would spoil the language surprise aspect for viewers, but if you watch it I think you'll understand why I said it could've been done better.I will say I did not enjoy the villain's acting. The villain didn't emote in a way that felt authentic so it didn't evoke the empathy that they could have received given the validity of their reason. The best villains are the ones with valid reasons, and this villain definitely had a valid reason to do bad things, so they by all means should have been a good villain. But the performance didn't make me feel empathy for the villain and if you knew me, you'd know I empathize easily and cry easy during movies. There definitely were other situations/characters in the movie that invoked emotion. But the villain was not one of them. I don't fully know if it was just bad acting, intentional, or the make-up/contacts made them feel unauthentic/uncanny but it did impact my enjoyment of the movie.So now that we covered the weak points, let's talk about the strong points: The leads were great, Captain Marvel, Captain Monica Rambeau, and Ms. Marvel. Their interactions were great, the acting, fighting, action, teamwork and everything was really well done. The soundtrack was good, the action sequences were good, the plot was also good and there were some really fun/silly scenes that left a lasting impression in the movie. I really enjoyed those aspects enough to make up for the lackluster villain performance. Most of the other actors also did an amazing job too. All in all I would say it's a good time.

title: Three ... can play that game
text: I know it is actually "two can play that game" (saying or song that is), so no pun intended ... hopefully. We finally get the three females as a group together - of course Captain Marvel had her standalone movie already. But the other two are new to the cinema screen. We got to see them (evolve) on the small screen. And I reckon Kamala Harris is the one that is able to shine brightest in this.I understand that some people are still feeling the highs of the Avengers movies (Infinity War and Endgame) and it is true that the new movies since then feel a bit disconnected ... or at least not as connected as the old ones. You have to suspend your disbelief and just enjoy what they try to do here.I could point out that everyone seems to be speaking English, no matter where or when they are from (I reckon no matter the planet, universe or reality) ... or that they use days and hours as a system we as viewers can relate to. But in space that would not make sense. The movie is pointing out the up and down in space - or rather it is made fun of. But even that is only touched slightly ... then you have make up and hair in space ... not sure what the vastness of space would do to ones hair ... even to an individual that is as powerful as ... Thanos (or close to).Though with so much power ... would she even need the help of anyone else? Again, you can nitpick a lot ... you can question a lot ... or you can just sit back, put your feet up high (if possible) and just enjoy the show. Apparently this was way darker in its first iteration ... but got extensive reshoots ... I have not read a lot about the original version ... but there may have been a connection to Loki that does not really exist now.That said, I thought the effects were fine, the jokes were at least good (some were even great, again looking at you Miss Marvel and family) ... and Nick Fury adding some needed foundation and grounding ... and solutions when needed.There is darkness, there is a lot of loss of life or at least destruction ... but there is also light ... and there is another added bonus scene mid credit. After credits scene? None, just some audio that I reckon is a funny touch ... but maybe not worth the wait in the cinemas if you watch it there ... if you are fast forwarding at home ... you probably will miss it - due to you looking out for a visual scene - and there is none.The story continues ... and there is a lot to be discovered - this is light entertainment - nothing more, nothing less. Story moves straight forward ... and I liked it ...quirky humor and even the "Bollywood" inspired set piece and scene did work ... mostly.

title: A Marvelous Film
text: The Marvels was my most anticipated mcu project this year. The return of breakout characters like Kamala Khan and the rest of the Khan family was an absolute treat. They carried the same great family energy from the Ms Marvel show over to the comically entagled joyride that is The Marvels. Getting to see the reunion of "Loitenant Trouble" and her Aunt Carol was emotional and well earned. The dynamic between the main trio was serious at times, but fun and whimsical when it needed to be. This is a very quick paced movie which was nice, it didn't bore you or drag out sequences. It left me wanting more of these characters and their lives, but I would rather want more than be sick of them. I can't wait to watch this movie again.

title: It's not Perfect but it is Puuurrrfect
text: The cancel culture against cancel culture is evident in Marvel movies. I believe some of the audience has outgrown them. Although not perfect, it's a fun, family action adventure. Deep? No. Fun? Absolutely! The weak point is the villain. She has a background story that could be more deeply explored. The Marvel universe has become so vast that it feels like you need to watch countless other things to understand one movie. However, if you're looking for a cool, action-packed, and funny movie, this one is great! Its simplicity in storytelling, coupled with the high-stakes action typical of Marvel, makes it a worthwhile watch for fans and newcomers alike.

title: Surpasses the Original
text: This is the first time in awhile that I've enjoyed a Marvel movie in its entirety. I also liked how it felt long enough but wasn't a long marvel movie like the others. The Marvels ensemble are so good together, and a part, and there's plenty of action throughout to see the three of them fight, fly, and switch bodies-which is done very well.The movie is fun, funny, and action packed. The story is easy to follow too, I think even if you haven't seen much of the others prior.Kamala's character/actress are a welcome young energy. And her family too!The cats are cute.The end credits scene is super exciting as well.

title: The Marvels: A marvelous Tapestry of Story Telling, Visual Splendor and Franchise Harmony!
text: "The Marvels: A Marvelous Tapestry of Storytelling, Visual Splendor and Franchise Harmony"In the ever-evolving landscape of superhero cinema, "The Marvels" emerges as a tour de force, solidifying its place as the MCU's third cinematic masterpiece in 2023. Directed with finesse by [Director's Name], this film not only boasts a stellar ensemble cast featuring Brie Larson as Carol Danvers/Captain Marvel, Teyonah Parris as Monica Rambeau/Captain Rambeau, and Iman Vellani as Kamala Khan/Ms. Marvel, but it also weaves a spellbinding narrative, dazzles with breathtaking visuals, and seamlessly aligns with the intricate threads of the Marvel Cinematic Universe (MCU) continuity.*The Marvels: A Triumph in Storytelling*At the core of "The Marvels" is a narrative that transcends the confines of typical superhero fare. Brie Larson, reprising her role as Carol Danvers, delivers a performance that not only embodies the strength and resilience of the character but also explores the complexities of her journey post-"Endgame." The film delves into the nuances of Carol's relationships, particularly with Teyonah Parris' Monica Rambeau, creating an emotional resonance that propels the story forward.Monica Rambeau's character arc is a poignant exploration of her own superheroic journey. Teyonah Parris brings depth to the role, and her chemistry with Brie Larson is electrifying. The film intelligently uses Monica's connection to the events of "WandaVision" to deepen her character, contributing to the overarching narrative of the MCU.Iman Vellani's introduction as Kamala Khan injects a delightful sense of youthful energy into the film. Her wide-eyed enthusiasm, combined with the relatability of Kamala's character, makes her a standout addition to the MCU. The interplay between these three lead characters is a testament to the film's commitment to character-driven storytelling, ensuring that each protagonist has their moment to shine.*Visual Spectacle: A Feast for the Eyes*"The Marvels" raises the bar for visual storytelling in the superhero genre. The special effects team deserves commendation for crafting a visual spectacle that not only meets but exceeds the high expectations set by its predecessors. From awe-inspiring cosmic vistas to high-octane action sequences, every frame is a testament to the film's dedication to delivering a cinematic experience that is as visually stunning as it is narratively compelling.The cinematography captures the grandiosity of superhero battles while also embracing the intimate moments that define these characters. The seamless integration of CGI and practical effects creates a visually cohesive world that draws audiences into the fantastical realms of the MCU. Costume design, set pieces, and attention to detail contribute to the film's immersive quality, making it a visual feast for fans and cinephiles alike."The Marvels" masterfully navigates the intricate tapestry of the MCU continuity, skillfully incorporating past events while forging new paths for its characters. The film pays homage to its predecessors with subtle nods and references, creating a sense of interconnectedness that will undoubtedly delight long-time fans. The narrative seamlessly addresses the aftermath of "Endgame" and the evolving dynamics within the superhero landscape.The inclusion of Monica Rambeau, a character introduced in "Captain Marvel," adds a layer of continuity that feels organic and purposeful. The film acknowledges the events of "WandaVision," threading Monica's journey through grief and transformation into the broader narrative. This level of attention to past events not only enriches the storytelling but also rewards dedicated MCU enthusiasts.Kamala Khan's introduction is a highlight in terms of franchise expansion. "The Marvels" sets the stage for Ms. Marvel's future contributions to the MCU, cleverly integrating her character into the existing framework. The film not only respects the source material but also positions Kamala as a vital component of the evolving superhero landscape.In conclusion, "The Marvels" is not merely a superhero film; it's a cinematic triumph that skillfully balances character depth, visual spectacle, and franchise continuity. Brie Larson, Teyonah Parris, and Iman Vellani deliver performances that breathe life into iconic characters, while the film's visuals leave an indelible mark on the superhero genre.The seamless integration of past events, the exploration of character dynamics, and the introduction of new elements make "The Marvels" a standout addition to the MCU. As the third cinematic installment in 2023, it not only upholds the legacy of its predecessors but propels the Marvel Cinematic Universe into uncharted territories."The Marvels" is a testament to the enduring appeal of superhero storytelling when executed with passion, precision, and a deep understanding of the source material. As we eagerly anticipate the next chapter in the MCU, "The Marvels" stands as a shining beacon, reminding audiences why Marvel continues to reign supreme in the realm of cinematic superheroics.

title: The MCU is back on track!
text: The Marvels is a surprisingly good time at the theater. Iman Vellani steals the show and had us laughing and smiling through most of the movie. Teyonnah Paris brings the Monica you know from WandaVision completely back finally giving us some answers as to what happened between her and Carol. And let's talk about Brie Larson. It's no secret Brie can act but she's never really gotten much to do within the MCU. This movie finally lets Brie show her full range of emotions as we see her filled with sorrow to absolute joy.Despite how powerful these women are they came up with a way to make the challenge actually feel like something they had to overcome. This isn't an easy victory for them. There's a great training montage during the film that sees them work on their skills but even after that they aren't yet ready to win. And if they actually win in this movie at all is debatable.The villain is fairly forgettable like many Marvel villains. It felt like this was written to feature Ronan originally but then they remembered he was dead. Or possibly they planned to use another Kree we knew from the first movie. However, despite their forgetableness they truly were a force to be reckoned with clear motivations. They were prepared to accept their fate in the end because they believed in their cause so much.There were some very great moments throughout and some side characters like Kamala's family and a flerken (or more) really made some of the scenes all the more fun.If you like your movies to give you a smile this one is for you.

title: Great fun.
text: Really good fun, fast paced with a lot of heart. The 3 main stars are so great together. Not sure why there is so much hate for this? It's the first MCU entry I've really enjoyed in a long time. Well worth catching a a cinema.It has also has one of the funniest scenes in the MCU. Myself and my son were laughing our loud.I thought the villain was slightly underwritten but certainly not as hollow as others have suggested.Brie Larson is great as Cap. But the star is Ms Marvel.The end credits are certainly exciting, not sure if they mean much for future entries or not, but they had an audible gasoline from the audience none the less.

title: Good for what it is
text: This is a fun romp. There are many things to criticize the MCU for, and this film is certainly not exempt from them, however, it has a sense of humor about it that is perfectly balanced with its plot. It's not a boring waste of time like the last Ant-Man movie, nor is it two separate movies placed together like the last Thor movie. It's quite enjoyable. It does have a few problems, as I previously mentioned. The first problem is the MCU is a victim of its own success. Kamala Khan is an interesting character, and seeing her family try to deal with a ridiculous situation is quite entertaining, but there are a lot of Marvel fans who just watch the movies. And if you just watch the movie, Kamala just seems like an extra character added ridiculously to this Captain Marvel sequel. But it makes a lot of sense, Kamala is obsessed with Captain Marvel, takes her name after Captain Marvel, so she's Miss Marvel which means she is someone who looks up to Carol Danvers as did her niece when she was little. The other problem, is the Superman problem. Captain Marvel is MCU's equivalent of superman. And like Superman, it is incredibly hard to create a compelling narrative about someone whose powers are so overwhelming. So in this film, the question that's asked is what happens if you have the powers of a god, and you make mistakes? That plot is interesting, but it's a little overshadowed by the wackiness of the rest of the film, which like I said is quite enjoyable. So if you're on the fence about watching this film, give it a chance.

title: Great time, awesome 3D!!
text: I'd actually rate this one overall an 8 but figured I'd bump it up a notch to make up for the haters and trolls, most of whom probably never even saw the movie. From the minute it started it was obvious that they had designed the film with 3D in mind. Sure enough, it didn't disappoint. This was a nonstop display of visual wizardry so complex it can only be described as pyrotechnics. The action sequences were also a serious blast.The movie apart from the 3D was much better than I was expecting. It was pretty much non-stop action from the get go, they didn't waste time with filler.Film: 7.5 3D: 8.5.

title: Really fun and enjoyable
text: The marvels is a really fun and enjoyable movie the chemistry between the three main character is really nice and Kamala was the light of the show and the switching scenes were really cool the cinematography were really good and once you get out of the theaters you're gonna love the marvels but the billans was forgettable and not memorable and the time is really good 1 hr 46 minutes the movie knows what it is doing from the start it's silly but it knows how to control it silliness and that's what I loved a out the marvels and the soundtrack was really nice imthankmGod this is the vovid project for marvel.

title: Don't listen to the bad reviews!
text: Miss marvel stole thr show but everyone eas amazing, there are flaws but its a fun adventure with great acting, story is good and perfect superhero team up. There was one silly scene but in the grand scheme of the movie it made me laugh and there was plenty of callbacks and teasers for what's to fome and i can genuinely say im excited to see more of miss marvel and hopefully captain marvel too, she got a bad rep from toxic fans but this movie is an excellent continuation of her story and definitely wrote some of the wrongs people had with the first movie. There was no agenda pushing at all, it was simply a team up movie which was done very well.

title: What more do you want.
text: This movie was excellent I saw it in @ a 4D movie theater which was awesome in its own right. I really don't know what these people who are giving this movie a low rating want. It is a Marvel movie not a contender for the Oscar movie of the year category. This movie delivered what it was supposed to. Action and laughs. The dynamics of there enter connected relationships was fun to watch a bit shallow but AGAIN it a Marval movie people. I feel like most of these people went to hate watch. You know what they say you only find what your looking for. So if your looking for it to suck your going to find reason that it does.

title: My girls were enthralled
text: We went to watch The Marvels this afternoon in a freezing cinema. People were leaving due to the cold but my wife, three children, girls aged 13, 9 and 7 and I braved the cold to watch the film.I've seen the vitriol thrown at the film but I have to say, I was never less than entertained and at points laughed out loud. My children and wife loved every minute. What a change from the usual role models they're exposed to.We've kept up with all the Marvel series and films on Disney + but I can see that it would be confusing for those who haven't. I'd also quite like to watch it again as there were some glaring continuity errors that may have just been that I'd missed a bit.It's not serious and very lighthearted. But it was everything we needed for a brief (less than 2 hour) film. And my children didn't ask to leave to go to the bathroom once.

title: Fun the whole time, dynamic, and that's enough!
text: I'm gonna start the review by lauding the fight scenes. I don't think I've ever seen some with such compelling choreography. That is in great part due to the pitch of the movie, the switching places, and they exploited it to the maximum for these scenes and it was a delight to watch. They had a real rhythm and I was very much into them.The movie also had for itself simple, unbridled fun. It did not take itself deathly seriously, and accepted to be an experience that brought the audience in for what felt like sharing a nice time with it. Still, I felt great fondness for the characters and the bond they showed from the start then developped, was charmed again by the Khans' family dynamic, and of course, felt fear and sadness at some points as well. Not heart-breaking, earth-shattering fear and sadness, but nevertheless compelling and enjoyable.This was a thoroughly enjoyable experience and I'm looking forward to seeing more of the characters. One of the most unabashedly fun MCu movies in a while, reminding us that sometimes it's not about the stakes but about going back to the basics of what superheroes are. People like us, who try their very best, and who make us live adventures with them.

title: Triple Threat, Triple Backstories
text: It's an interesting movie, even if you've not seen all of the many strands that lead up to it.A lot of the key elements have no emotional resonance, though, if you've not seen, I suspect, the Ms Marvel small screen series, the Hawkeye small screen series, nor the Wandavision series. That's quite a bit of pre-reading, is it not?!I'd seen all the stuff leading up to Endgame and then the Wandavision series ... I think. Quantumania I also saw, along with Black Widow. This big screen effort was just as entertaining as those two, thought I.At worst there are far too many "in-joke" moments that fall flat for the uninitiated. At best, it is different having three lasses as your protagonists in a superhero movie. Each performer is committed to their respective roles, and the Big Bad does their absolute utmost with what material they had.Danvers' main plot point is given an afterthought's treatment, although Larson makes even this go a long way. It's a sacrifice made for having 3 main characters - each only gets 1/3 of the run-time's worth of attention.Look, it's a fun movie. I had no problem with it.

title: Not getting these reviews...
text: I was entertained. It was a lot better than Love and Thunder or Multiverse of Madness. There was only one cringey scene.The swapping was handled well. It made sense, and the disorientation felt right.I was never confused, even though I haven't gotten to watch any of the shows yet. It had a clear plot from beginning to end. It had continuation of previous plotlines.It maintained character development for Carol and Monica in a way that felt emotionally realistic.It had an exciting mid-credits scene.I really feel like some of these folks just hate Captain Marvel for not being a T&A superheroine.

title: Ignore the hate, this is great!
text: I've loved and watched all of the Marvel content, right from Blade onwards I've watched them all; and this film is an absolute joy to watch!The 3 main characters spark off of each other and Kamala's youthful energy and fan-girl exuberance counterbalances Captain Marvel's stoicism and lightens proceedings.There is a LOT of humour in this, the plot zips along and feels like it's been trimmed down to the bare bones. There could have easily been an extra scene or 2 to allow the characters to breathe and avoid too much exposition, but it's fine without them.It's fun and silly, like a comic, but not to the excess of Love & Thunder.If you're on the fence about seeing this ignore the hate. Yes the 3 main characters are women. Yes the main villain is a woman. But really, that should not matter one bit. Ultimately this is a fun joyful film about a fan teaming up with their hero and as a comic lover, what's not to like about that?!

title: Not the best... But I do like MCU
text: I think they are searching their way now, but I do trust Marvel, that they will find it. It's not too long and like making the path for something bigger. There is always room. There is always way to tell a story and not with the multiverse the possibilities are endless. Bring back the old avengers? Maybe. I hope they will and the new caterers characters will play together with the old ones.I think they are searching their way now, but I do trust Marvel, that they will find it. It's not too long and like making the path for something bigger. There is always room. There is always way to tell a story and not with the multiverse the possibilities are endless. Bring back the old avengers? Maybe. I hope they will and the new caterers characters will play together with the old ones.

title: A Good Superhero Movie
text: In The Marvels, I praised the chimestry between Carol, Kamala, and Monica, action sequences, visual and sound effects, short 105 minutes runtime, story, direction, soundtrack, comedic moments, ending, and mid credits scene, which tells us that the Marvel Cinematic Universe still has a lot of surprises and secrets to show in the future.Regarding the flaws, what I didn't like is some parts of the screenplay and some messy plot elements, which made the person who is watching really confused and lost sometimes.But these flaws won't prevent me from giving a high score to the Marvels, because I liked it, and I am looking forward to see what more the MCU is hiding for us in the future. When it comes to the score, I gladly give The Marvels 8 out of 10.

title: Ignore the inevitable low scores!
text:
So went into this not knowing what to expect as these days there's so much bad press about superhero movies before they're even released! I enjoyed Monica Rambau in Wandavision, I enjoyed Ms Marvel and really enjoyed the first Captain Marvel. And to be honest I was pleasantly surprised as I really enjoyed this (apart from one part...but let's not make a song and dance about it)
The zippy 1h45 runtime was perfect, no boring long moments where nothing happens, it's literally action from the get go! The effect were great, I didn't have any problems with them at all! The three leads were also great and bounced off each other perfectly, the body swapping action scenes were well choreographed also. And above all it was just a fun time, which I think has been sorely missed in films recently!! I recommend ignoring low scores and check it out for yourself.

title: One of Marvel's Best!!
text: Loved every minute.Where to start? Let's go with the star herself - Brie Larson. Incredible in everything she does, but even more so when playing Captain Marvel. Equally adapt at comedy, drama, & action - she brings her A game to all here.Ms Marvel brings a fresh, young presence to the film, which has been sorely lacking in most comic books films. She definitely steals the more humorous moments.Parris - didn't care for her in the lackluster WandaVision series, but he comes into her own her, even though she plays a second fiddle to both other Marvels.Fury - maybe his best performance yet.The film is truly captivating while we seen more of the Marvel Universe "universe".

title: Absolutely a good MCU movie!
text: I am obviously a minority here but I am really puzzled by all the hate for this movie. What did everyone expect exactly? And since when did everyone become such an expert?This movie is absolutely a perfectly fine MCU instalment. It is not as good as any of the Avengers team movies but much better than say Iron Man 1-2 or Captain America the First Avenger etc. The story was for me compelling, especially since I am not a huge fan of all the time travel stuff. It was a story of friendship, redemption and recognizing your mistakes. The action scenes were great, the CGI was great and the acting was great. Brie Larson is doing absolutely a fantastic job as Captain Marvel again, and the trio just works fine. I actually really liked the villain story. Not one of those heavy but also often senseless ones in the comics but a villain out of need. So all in all, I really enjoyed this movie, I will gladly see it again. A 10 from me!

title: Superhero spectre
text: This movie has has the grip which everyone one wants while watching the movie, screenplay is brilliant and cast has been picked basis the story which shows perfect thought process of the director, one can understand how this movie would have narrated according to the script, a binge history, director has brought the exact outcome what can be expected from the cast selected for the movie and music is also good which adds brightness of the movie . Beautiful subject and scope is also fantastic will hit Box office if support is provided to movie, will request all to support such movie because efforts must be valued by the society and gives courage to the newcomers as well.

title: Okay! Not as bad as made out
text: I thought the movie was good as it links a few characters from different series, I loved Monica in WandaVision and didn't mind captain marvel, only got through half of ms marvel but watching this film has made me want to carry on watching! Plus the post credit scene is epic can't wait for them to implement what we know is comingI enjoyed the movie but cared about the characters involved and have seen their back story, so was keen to see how they developed and loved the interacts as a team, the swapping powers was a little confusing as to why they were as not much explanation on that fact, but other than that it's a solid film that leads us to a whole MCU.

title: Super fun for all ages!
text: A really fun new MCU entry that is totally undeserving of all the hate I'm seeing for it. It's fast-past and clever with a lot of multi-generational heart. It is SO REFRESHING to have a more light-hearted MCU film, not quite as silly as Thor Ragnarok, but still very entertaining. The thing I love about it most is how HUMAN everyone is. They may have superpowers, but it doesn't make them gods. They still are awkward and figuring things out and they are dealing with the consequences of their powers and decisions. Also VERY CLEVER world building - visiting other worlds with vastly different ways of life - the design and execution is just perfect. Give this film a chance and you won't regret it!

title: Easily one of the best Marvel movies from the Multiverse Saga.
text: Was this movie a little odd? Sure. Were there a few unnecessary parts? Sure. Was the scene everyone is so annoyed about that different from the dance off in Guardians of the Galaxy? I don't think so.If you go into this movie expecting something serious you're going to be disappointed. If you go in open-minded and don't expect it to be the next Avengers: Endgame you'll enjoy it. Bonus points if you're a cat lover. Extra bonus points if you have the most basic music theatre knowledge.This was easily one of the best Marvel movies from phase 4 or 5 and a refreshing change from the slog of the Eternals and the stupidity of Quantumania.

title: Very much worth seeing if you love all parts of the MCU.
text: Going in to see this, I was a bit concerned. The initial reviews were not promising. In my head, it felt like the MCU was falling into DC territory. For context, I'll say this - I'm a 50 something father who's followed the MCU with my 20 something son from the outset. Am I hard-core? No, but my son is. We watched every Disney+ Marvel series and I try to see the movies in the theatres if I can.With all that, I found The Marvels to be extremely satisfying. Period. The issues between Carol and Monica were explained and resolved without a long drawn out affair. Kamala added a lot to the cast being a Fangirl of Captain Marvel and her character was beautifully portrayed by Iman Vellani. I will say this - having watched Ms Marvel on Disney+ did help a great deal because the family was added to the cast for the movie. For me, this add was a bonus.Now, are there things to criticize with this movie? For me, no. But again, I have all of the knowledge that is needed to get the full extent of what the story is laying out. If you don't have this, there's things you can nitpick about, most definitely. When I look at it from that vantage point, it does concern me, though. As Phase 1 rolled out, with every film I would be cautious and tell my son to not get his hopes up too high, but by the time Avengers came out, I was amazed. They had executed something I had never seen before. And with the closing credits for End Game, I knew I had been witness to something that was never done before and it would be extremely difficult to follow up. Is it impossible? Only time will tell.So... here we are. The Marvels is the 3rd movie in Phase 5 - PHASE 5 PEOPLE!!! There's so much I could say here but the reality is this. If you're going to go to one of these movies now with no background knowledge of what the MCU is, it's gonna be challenging. This is unfortunate for us - the movie goers, because if the performance at the box office stumbles, this will affect how Disney will go forward with things. I know it's easy to look at most of these films now and be hyper critical. But considering there's been 30+ movies now, with a continuity that I suspect most in the industry envy, it would be nice to see a more measured tone in these reviews. I can honestly say I thoroughly enjoyed The Marvels. I will probably go back to see it again in the theatres if I can.

title: Delightful and Bright
text: Listen, I get it. As Marvel fans we've had a rough phase. Love and Thunder was a mess, and Quantum-whatsit completely forgot what works about Ant-Man. (Seriously, as soon as Luis isn't in the movie there's a problem in AntLand.)But, listen. Think back to early MCU. Remember how fun it was? Remember how you didn't have to watch 30 films to know what was going on? Wasn't it nice?The Marvels is a return to that joyful, less entangled time. Honestly, you could get away with only seeing Captain Marvel before watching this...though why you'd deny yourself the joy of Ms. Marvel I do not know. I cannot express how nice it is to just be able to enjoy a Marvel film.In this trim film, Carol Danvers is back, but this time she's not alone. The additions of Monica Rambeau and Kamala Khan help prevent Captain Marvel from falling into being a one-dimensional character. We are reminded that, super-powered though she may be, Carol is still human. She makes mistakes, she gets scared, and she has to remember that she doesn't have to go it alone.And honestly, Teyonah Parris and Iman Vellani are wonderful additions to the MCU. Teyonah is soulful, thoughtful, and nuanced in her performance. Iman is all heart, bringing that same joy and exuberance that I think we all felt as Marvel fans when the MCU began. Park Seojoon was also a delight, but we barely scratched the surface on what he can do. Dear Kevin, please give us more Prince Yan and his stunning kingdom.If you are expecting a serious epic, you will be disappointed. This movie is not Endgame or Wakanda Forever. Instead, this is a joyful, comedic romp. It embraces the absurdity of space cats and super-powered teenagers with verve. And I couldn't stop laughing; it was just fun.Also, I loved the way Nia directed the film. The women are strong and beautiful, but they're not there to be objects. The fight scenes were dynamic and engaging. And some of the comedic choices were absolutely hilarious.If there was one thing the film needed it was more development of Zawe Ashton's Dar-Benn. There were threads of an incredibly interesting backstory, and Zawe is a very talented actress. But it almost feels like the movie needed another fifteen minutes to the runtime to help flesh out Dar-Benn more. And normally I'm the first person to say a film could be shorter.Overall, though, this movie is a great time.

title: Expand your youniverse
text: THE MARVELS: Movie. If you have felt like it's the end of the world, love brings light and light brings the beginning of a new youniverse. I encourage every family, every parent, every child and every woman to go see a truly magical movie. The first Marvel movie by Disney in a long while to express the family values of Disney through a work of love, light, awe and wonder. Guardians of the Galaxy team-up vibes propel us to The Marvels of the Universe as Marvel goes truly intersteller. Don't let the vibrant remine energy of this penultimate cinematic triumph discourage you. Lean into it. Take it on board. Expand your youniverse. There's something here for everyone. And if you're a man and you don't see this film, you'll miss out on the opportunity to get back in touch with your inner child. This movie is like the first time that you experienced an exotic food. Years later that food is a personal favourite.

title: Everything I hoped it would be!
text: I personally thought this movie was great! It has a fun and creative mechanic used throughout the film, the humour was great, albeit more subtle and natural which may not be for everyone, but I think it was done really well. Also, can't forget the leads of the movie who do a great job.The main 3 leads did a great job, had great chemistry with each other and were fun with lots of fun moments of the characters and the peculiar scenarios where the characters can play off each others different personalities.(I will also say, over the years the Internet has chastised Captain Marvel for "not having personality". Regardless of your thoughts on her in the first movie, you can tell that the director heard the backlash and she is now has a lot of personality and heart. Though, I still defend that Captain Marvel needed to be portrayed as Stoic for their first movie.)The villain of the movie, while sometimes treated like more of a plot point, still has a solid motivation. Though, I don't think the focus needed to be more on her, she has a presence in the film but she's not the main focus of it. She also much like the premise of this movie uses a fun and creative approach to something we have already seen to reuse it in a new and exciting way.All round just a fun watch, while also starting to tie in other parts of the MCU together which I feel like the Internet has been dying for.

title: A BLAST
text: Right from the get go, the film whisks us into a story of space-time switcheroo madness and superhero friendships. The trio of Marvels work together to save the universe while at the same time being engaging, funny and relatable. Ms Marvel is the fan in all of us, geeking out at finally meeting her superhero idols.Music was also uplifting, though I did miss the Captain Marvel theme from the original score of Captain Marvel.Don't miss the mid credit sequence -- it is a mind blower.Very much looking forward to seeing this one again. Saw it in IMAX 3D and it did not disappoint!Thanks again Marvel for the ride!

title: A Cosmic Breath of Fresh Air
text: In the realm of superhero cinema, where the world's fate hangs in the balance with every blockbuster release, The Marvels (2023) emerges as a refreshing and invigorating addition to the genre. Deviating from the formulaic pattern of impending doom and destruction, this film infuses a lighthearted touch, introducing a diverse cast of characters and exploring themes of cultural authenticity and intercultural harmony.The narrative follows Carol Danvers, the titular Captain Marvel, as her cosmic powers intertwine with those of Kamala Khan, the enthusiastic Ms. Marvel, and Monica Rambeau, a rising star in the world of space exploration. Together, this unlikely trio must unite to confront an intergalactic threat that jeopardizes the very fabric of reality.Amidst the grand spectacle of cosmic battles and awe-inspiring superpowers, The Marvels deftly balances humor and heart. The characters' interactions are infused with genuine camaraderie and witty banter, creating a sense of relatability that resonates with the audience.The film's sound design is particularly noteworthy, seamlessly blending dynamic sound effects with a captivating score. The soundtrack, composed by the talented Michael Giacchino, perfectly complements the action sequences and emotional moments, enhancing the overall cinematic experience.The Marvels stands out for its commitment to diversity and cultural authenticity. The cast represents a wide range of ethnicities and backgrounds, reflecting the multicultural world we live in. The film also tackles issues of intercultural disharmony, highlighting the challenges and rewards of bridging cultural divides.In a landscape often saturated with repetitive superhero tropes, The Marvels emerges as a refreshing breath of fresh air. Its lighthearted tone, diverse cast, and emphasis on cultural authenticity make it a must-see for fans of the genre and newcomers alike.

title: Excellent Movie
text: This was a thoroughly enjoyable and light hearted film. A breath of fresh air after Guardians of the Galaxy 3 which was a very good film but the subject matter and length of the film did make it feel heavy at times. By contrast this film was very much on the short end.The humour was on point, the interaction between the main protagonists was excellent and Brie Larson certainly redeemed her more average performance from her Origin film.Plot moved along at a steady pace with a villain that you could understand their motivations even if you didn't agree with their methods to achieve their goals.As for the incredibly negative reviews, one can't help but suspect as is customary in this day and age for anything involving Marvel or Star Wars or basically any franchise at this stage, if the lead protagonists are all female/ethnicall diverse/LGBTQ that this has been targeted for negative reviews. For evidence look at essentially all films in the MCU where these characteristics are the lead and watch people try and justify their poor ratings with little to back it up.Overall, don't believe the people who can't wait to hate on any films that the MCU throw out that aren't headlined by white men and watch it with an open mind and you'll likely find you enjoy it. If you don't, there's always Samuel L Jackson to fall back on who is a treasure.

title: Short but a banger!!
text: Before you go into this review, one thing get into your mind, don't listen to the bad reviews, just forget how the marvel is going nowadays and think like you are just watching a movie, that's it, that's it nothing else, not the characters, not the actors, not the delays etc etc. Now on the movie, this movie is a banger I really mean that, no boring no wasting time, just delivered a neat good story which includes some good jokes, not some typical marvel jokes nowadays they are using, and the jokes are actually fits the scene, and the most important is, the CGI, just wow really I'm just stunned by their editors/CGI work really, coz all this time since the phase 4 started(you know how the CGI looked)I've been saying to myself that, this CGI looks good, even tho it's not, but after watching this, they actually uped the CGI work and gave their air to breathe, ok now about the story, as I said, it was a good neat story no lag, but I feel like it would've been lil good if they had story arc within each other's and lil time with themselves, as you all say the trailer/trailers it all be soo quick, like the story starts quickly and it feels like it ends quickly, sooo yea, neat and worth watching movie, coming to the acting, they did a great acting, and I really loved Carol(Brie Larson), fury(jakson), and Ms marvel stoles the show by her cute appearance, coming to the villain, ummmm not the baddest but, okeish I guess, that's it with the villain, and that's a minus point sooo yup, and speaking about the post credit scene and before the post credit scene, which are the greatest thing in the movie, ok I'm not gonna spoil the movie for you guys, so thank me later, soo before the post credit scene is very very important to the upcoming future of MCU or MSHEU whatever you wanna call, ok I'll just give you a clue, the scene is about MSHEU yea that's right, I guess you get it, if you read comics well enough, ok moving on to the second post credit scene, I gotta say, it really slapped me, like it slapped me sooooo hard like when u get slapped, you feel the surge of shock, the surprise or etc etc, why I'm saying this is, coz the post credit is in next level like best thing or one of the best thing ever in the MCU, it's easily one of the best post credit scene in the MCU, it's really very important to the future of the MCU, and if you don't like the movie, story, actors or the characters means ok, just leave it, you can just come to this movie just for the post credit scene itself, trust me it's worth the hype, just you won't though it would be like this or it connects like this, and I suggest you to watch this movie in IMAX coz it's mind blowing, that's it, idk if you followed my story till now, if you did, thank you and enjoy your watch, peace.

title: IN THE DEFENSE OF THE MARVELS - A VERY MAJESTIC FILM
text: Man, I actually enjoyed this masterpiece. It took off better than the last Captain Marvel film, which was forgettable but okay at the same time. I understand that Captain Marvel is no one's favorite superhero but she seems really nice to me.The story is so neat and enjoyable. Very unpredictable plot and the moments are so unforgettable. Sure, I haven't seen the Ms. Marvel show but half of the episodes but getting to see Ms. Marvel on the big screen satisfied me a lot. Including Monica Rambeau, whom she's as OP as the two. Technically the Marvels Trio is really damn OP in a very suprisingly way. Great music that hyped me up.I genuinely hope this movie took off just like Thor: Love and Thunder. Let's hope that Deadpool 3 takes off next year!

title: The Marvels is so fun!
text: This movie is such a slam dunk, particularly in the face of Marvel's recent lackluster output. This is a quick film that--much like the protagonists being pulled from their location--pulls its audience forward continually, never wasting a moment. More than anything, this movie is FUN. It's action-packed, it's funNY, and it's exciting. It follows some of the same superhero template, but it also plays with the genre and introduces some playful elements.The interplay between the three leads is just impeccable. The Khan family is endearing. Fury is such a Fun Grandpa. The flerken scene is tears-in-your-eyes hilarious.Every character has an arc-defining moment and everything just feels like it works so naturally. Already planning to go again.

title: Poignant and delightful
text: One of the most beautiful Marvel movies to date. Like a parfait, the layers of expression, emotion, and experience made this movie thoroughly enjoyable. Brie is a brilliant actress who leads with the fullest commitment to strength and duty. Iman is the future and she delivers on the promises made on TV. Teyonah gives an astounding performance, filled with a bold breadth of subtle emotions.This had all the elements of a great Marvel movie. Complex, intriguing storyline. Well-developed characters with intertwined stories. Plucky comic relief.Yes, it was comprised of all these and more as well. The depths of human frailty and failure and the hope and passion of redemption.I absolutely loved this film and look forward to seeing this story develop and expand.

title: Really loved this movie!!
text: This movie was so much fun!! The chemistry between the leads was so good. Iman Vellani reactions to captain marvel were absolutely priceless and Teyonah Parris full debut as spectrum (her name from the comics) was awesome. I could not wait to see her in action ever since we just got a glimpse of what she can do in Wanda Vision. This movie for me would be considered one of the best I've seen since Miles Morales into the spider verse. I didn't find the story jarring or the comedic elements out of place. It felt like a fun and ride. Marvel did a great job injecting some life into super hero genre. Lastly that end credit scene has really got me excited to see what's coming next!

title: Just watch this with an open mind
text: I come to the cinema with lots of bad reviews in mind, but once i start to watch the movie and just focus on the screen, forget all previous reviews, then i sincerely enjoy the movie, it is light, funny, action packed. Captain Marvel is "human" in this film, she is not a tough invincible heroine anymore, she is not a feminist anymore, she has weakness, emotion and can be beaten by the villain. Ms. Marvel is fresh, loveable and helps with the mood of the movie, i dont watch the series Ms. Marvel so she is totally new to me but i can still understand everything frim the get go. Rambeau is a so-so one, not strong, not funny, not smart, she is just there to make a team but it's ok. I think if anyone go to the cinema with an open mind, noy comparing this one with anything then they can fully enjoy the movie as it is, a light entertainment for family.

title: You "Critiques" need to chill out
text: I went in there watching and readings the reviews of this movie. The moment I walked in, I wanted it to end but my fiance really wanted to watch it. We've watched Ms. Marvel and love that show. Marvel herself was my least favorite of the MCUWith that said. This movie is extremely enjoyable! K. K is such a fan girl but when it's time to show up, she kick major ass and holds her own. Marvel is so much more likeable this time around and Monica was fantastic as well.The way they mashed together was so fluid. Idk why you guys hate this movie so much. It was funny, the action sequences were great. The only downside IMO is the villain. I see her motive but she's practically a nobody.Hate on my review all you want my I haven't yet read or watched a valid reason to hate this movie or accept that it's this low in raitings. It's not that bad.

title: If you like having fun
text: This movie was so much fun! The chemistry between the leading ladies Brie Larson, Teyonah Parris and Iman Vellani was amazing. The moment they all were on screen together it just perfect. Ms Marvel's family stole the show. So many laughs! Great fight sequence's and ending and after credits scene! I hope it gets those who didn't watch Ms Marvel excited about watching her show! Which is also a good fun show. I've watched a many a movie that got low reviews and they're known as classics today. It wasn't perfect but it was just a good time and I definitely plan on seeing it again. Go see the movie and judge for yourself!

title: Girls can be super heroes too!
text: I'm not sure why everyone is hating on this I can only assume it's because it's different.The Marvels to me is aimed at a younger audience, it's not as dark as other Marvel films and because of this I took my 9 year old daughter for a father and daughter trip as it's a 12A in the UK any child under 12 can go but must be accompanied.After see ms Marvel come out I used it to bring my daughter into the world of superheros because it's aimed at a younger audience and so this appealed to my daughter both due to the age of ms Marvel and the way the show was written which I was then able to lead her into this film knowing she knew the character already.This film is definitely aimed at a younger audience and to me and one of my reasons for taking her was to show that girls can kick butt too!It had plenty of funny scenes to keep me and my daughter laughing hard!And some epic well made fight scenes I say epic in that the way most of them where funny and well put together.Please if you have pre-teen/teen daughter's inspire them that girls can be superheros too and go watch this film together for action/laughter and above all hope that girls are just as super as boys!I've now got to watch another Disney+ series to help her understand the last few moments of the film but that gives us an opportunity to have even more quality time together <3.

title: Hell it was fun
text: Was this movie perfect? Hell no the plot was thin and there wasn't much character development but Damm did I have a good time watching this movie and that's what it's all about. I had a smile across my face for the entire 1 hr 45 minute runtime. All the characters are very likeable Kamala and her family being the standouts, the action is some of the best post endgame, the visuals are really strong and the camera movement was really well done. The villain although weak and forgettable actually had good motivations and the story was simple anyone who says it's too messy or doesn't make sense must be a bit daft because it was thin but very obvious. In short the marvels is short and sweet and if you're in the mood to have fun at the cinema this is the film to see.

title: Marvel needs more of this
text: Marvel finally back to doing what they are good at again. Funny, witty, full of chemistry between actors both the leading and supporting cast, and the classic marvel feels good touch. We love this! Want more with Brie, Iman, and Teyonah - they were simply brilliant!!The supporting cast, especially Kamela's family, had perfect comedic timing. The positive and loving family that wants to be supportive and protective was portrait effortlessly. The relatable storylines between characters in the middle of superhero chaos brought us back to the magic of marvel.After a few misses from Marvel, this feels like the start of something much better. Looking forward to strong female lead scripts like this one where women empower other women.

title: This movie was really Fun
text:
This movie was surprisingly good. It's not perfect and a tad bit short, but it embodies what a superhero flick should be. The chemistry of the cast was was really good. Khamala Khan really stole the show. It was nice to see a more wittier side of Nick Fury. I think this movie have a little more character to captain Marvel which was well needed. Monica Rambeau really shined in here second MCU appearance as a superhero. The only flaw to me was the short ending & it seems the mcu is still not connecting the stories of late. But, My daughters love superhero movies
And it's nice to give the a chance to see women hero's take the lead!

title: Fun
text: It's a good time. If u like feel good movies and comedy, you'll like it. Gorgeous visuals and excellent chemistry from the cast. Iman Villani was amazing and a stand out. Nia decosta did an excellent job at directing. I wish it was longer, it was very fast paced. Once again, cast chemistry made up for it. Go see it this weekend! I hope you enjoy it as much as I did. As I was leaving the theater, there was a kid that said they wanted to watch it all over again. That made me smile. I wish this movie got more press and marketing, but there was a strike going on. Anyways, definitely go see this movie! Have fun!

title: A return to Marvel form
text: This movie is what I go to the cinema for: Fun! Sure, there are some issues with the film, primarily the very quick pacing. This film was aggressively edited, but I prefer a breezy film over a slog like The Eternals.What is great here are the strong, human, and fun characters: everybody in the cast feels vibrant, much more than in their previous appearance. ESPECIALLY Carol Danvers. I see other reviews saying she's just a plot device in this movie. This is true of her other MCU appearances, but here she has emotion, an arc, and actually utilizes Brie Larson's skills as an actorGive this film a chance and go have fun at an MCU movie again!

title: Spectacular Film - One of Marvel's Best
text: The MarvelsFirst of all, if you're a Marvel fan, you know you have to see everything that came before the movie to understand. Captain Marvel, WandaVision and Ms. Marvel are wonderful movies/tv shows and should be watched regardless of this movie. But it's a heck of a lot easier to understand the plot if you've seen them first.The Marvels captivated me the way Marvel movies tend to do, but this one was different. The themes of family, coming of age, revenge, guilt and teamwork are fully brought to life. Marvel has always been more than just Hulk Smash. The stories resonate with me as I enjoy the human (or non human) interactions that continue across multiple movies and shows. The characters develop through interpersonal relationships as they grow and learn, which for us fanboys, means more of it as Marvel has this uncanny ability to inspire feelings of family and friendship for the fictional characters. The attention to detail is A+ and as you know, there will be moments that gasp in the theatre with surprise and happiness. I know I did.Stay for the mid credit scene. They always have one, of course. But this? Wow. I have been waiting over 30 years and it's finally happening.

title: Pretty Solid Transitional Movie
text: The reviews were harsh so I had expectations that I'd hate it like the most recent Thor movie. This was a pretty good rebound and thought I understand the communities frustration with the obsession with ill-times comedic relief and some very forgettable villains.That said, I truly enjoyed what feels like an update and bridge between Endgame & Doctor Strange (which was highly successful imo). It feels like we're connecting the dots in these time rips and though it may feel chaotic now, these small doses will feel more profound when the story comes full circle. That's what I hope! Good job!I also must say that the mom in this movie is so funny. Ms. Marvels family had us all laughing.

title: Really good - surprisingly.
text: I really enjoyed this movie - far more than I thought that I would. I wasn't intending to watch this movie but on recommendation of my daughter realized that I should give it a shot. I admit that it had some interesting parts and it was quite comical - some of the lines from Samuel L Jackson 'Nick Fury' were the best parts of the movie.The action sequences and the lessons and morale that are evident through the story are engrossing and the characters each have both relatable good qualities and a few natural flaws that make them seem believable. The MCU ideals of incursions and universes overlapping starts to play out to tie in other attributes of the Marvel worlds and it was fun to see how they did that.No need for spoilers, obviously, but I will say as with all Marvel films make sure you stay until the end of the credits to see a bonus scene that gives interesting insight into what may or may not occur within the MCU next.

title: Better than aquaman
text: I was afraid not to waste money for a cinema ticket to see the marvels based on all the reviews I've seen before that affected the image of the movie, therefore i was waiting to appear on Disney + and I can say It's quite good. Can't wait for upcoming movies, I am a marvel fan since I was a child and I've seen all the movies so far and I'm in love with them. I hope there will be more series with each hero and I wish to make another season at least of she hulk, Hawkeye and Loki. To conclude this, the marvels it's a very good movie and you should watch and give a good rating, it's worth watching.

title: WOW! this movie really was a Marvel!!!
text: I have have not said this since 2022 when my favorite movie Morbius came out, BUT THIS MOVIE WAS SO GOOD THEY HAD ME WANTING MORB. I thought Morbius was Marvels last good movie and Marvels peak but this movie made me Morb around the theater one more time and it was great! When the movie was over the whole theater got up and started spinning because it was very spectacular. This movie may be my favorite movie but Morbius might still be better due to the choreography in its fights. When the Marvels ended milk shot out of my nose and stuff.This Movie is truly represents Marvels mission which is to make not great movies but fantastic movies for their fans. The story was immaculate but I do not want to really spoil anything because the story is incredible. I cannot understand why people are rating this movie bad because it was incredible and I just think people are jealous that they can't make a better movie than this. I booked a ticket for everyday of the week so I can watch this movie again. Kamala Harris (Ms. Marvel) was a really good character and had good chemistry with captain marvel. My only criticism is that the movie is not one minute longer because I feel like they rushed it by not giving us that extra minute of movie. The story was creative and only intelligent minds would be able to follow and understand which might be another reason why people are rating this movie bad.The villain was basically the next Morbius and is my second favorite villain of all time Morbius is just a little bit better.They need to higher Nia Dacosta as the official Marvel director because she did an incredible job and i'd like to see a sequel to this movie but with Morbius in it because that would give us even morb.Truly what a marvelous movie they have made. I am impressed.IT'S MORBIN TIME!!!

title: One of the most fun times I've had a Marvel movie!
text: I thoroughly enjoyed my time watching this movie! This is easily one of the most fun movies that Marvel has made. I hope that there are more in this direction! I brought my three kids, and they all had a good time and are excited to see where these characters go from here on. They (we) are all excited about that final secret scene and its implications! Seriously, though, watch this movie. Relax, enjoy the ride, and have fun. This movie did bring joy. I had a good time, and more importantly, my children had a good time and were talking excitedly about the film all day afterward! Do yourself a favor and watch this one!

title: Fun! Do yourself a favor check it out.
text: Most of these reviews want to focus on the MCU or the politics of it all but this movie is just a FUN TIME and the power switching conundrum these heroes see themselves in is highly unique, entertaining and done fairly well for how ambitious it is.Ms. Marvel/Kamala Khan is an absolute gem, I'm not surprised that she's becoming a much bigger part of the MCU and hope people get to see her in action.One thing Marvel/Star Wars is going to give you with movies is polish, say what you will but no other studio is consistently doing it as clean as they are. This was way better than Ant Man Quantum Mania and a great look at other heroes/storylines in the MCU.

title: So happy I ignored the doomers and saw this movie!
text: I made the mistake of reading other reviews before going to see The Marvel's. This is a great movie, with touches of appropriate emotions, some fun, and a lot of terrific action. Superb music, too, something important to me. The best part was the interactions between the main characters, with believable growth in their relationships. I really enjoyed Brie Larsen in this outing as well, much more than the first Captain Marvel. The humor was character-driven, some really sharp writing. Also, either the CGI was phenomenal or they had some fantastic practical sets (and incredibly well-trained cats!). I'm so glad I saw The Marvels!

title: Just a fun film. Don't let the haters distract you.
text: It was just fun from start to finish. A great stand alone movie that you can enjoy without having to watch the others. You will manage and understand what is going on. Great for families and adults alike. I Laughed from start to finish and Ms Marel stole the show a little, she is just charismatic and brilliant in the role. It was just a great entertaining movie - sometimes you need just a fun stand alone film, and this is what it is. Don't let the haters dissuade you from giving this one a go - they are always out there, but this one is worth the shot. If you want a light hearted super hero film, that is funny, this is your thing.

title: Really fun movie
text: I don't get the negative reviews here other than it's popular to diss on Marvel. I guess people have forgotten how to have fun at a movie. The story takes place mostly in space which was great as well. It was a straightforward story. None of the multiverse stuff that we've been overwhelmed with lately. The straight forward story was refreshing, at least for me anyway. All three Marvels are incorporated into the movie nicely and we get the explanation for what happened at the end of the Ms. Marvel TV show. And the two end credit scenes are, well just wow. And one a nod to a wonderful scene from the first Iron Man. The people in my showing all clapped at the end.

title: Good fun and banter and great casting.
text: Given serious let down by recent MCU releases, The Marvels may be the saviour it needed to hold on to slipping fans for a little longer. Great casting and the trio smashed their chemistry test. Fight scenes and Graphics never fail in an MCU film, but would love to see more character development from these three. Surprisingly, upcoming star Iman Vellani was the shining star of the film for me with her wit and comical delivery. Yes, a slight change of the serious tone and direction from previous films but we all knew this franchise is focused on drawing in the next generation of younger crowds. With that intent in mind, this film executed well. Id watch it again at the theatre.

title: An enjoyable slice of escapism
text: I have seen so many bad reviews, and negative comments before this film even aired, but I went in with an open mind anyway. And I am glad I did as this movie was so much fun! I think people's expectations are so high now, but not ever movie can be endgame level and it's great to go back to a basic, team-up marvel movie with the added bonus of women being at the centre. You can choose to take it too seriously, or you can hop on to this ride and sit back to relax and enjoy. The Marvels was an enjoyable slice of escapism. The plot was exciting with just the right amount of danger, there was some fantastic pieces of humour and some great fight scenes. Plus there's some exciting teasers for upcoming events in the MCU too ;) worth a watch, and can't wait to see what's next.

title: A fun ride with a little surprise and twist at the end
text:
The Marvels as the name says is really a marvel ,it's a very fun movie with a good story and amazing acting by iman vellani and brie larson .Really loved their roles and finally got to see samuel jackson in good role after secret invasion. Nice to see awsha in a negative role she also acted really well and was looking impact full. And kamala's family was just so natural and hilarious loved their roles in the movie.The VFX was amazing really you can feel like you were in space .And special mention for Goose who was a large part of the movie this time
. Loving The Marvels!!! They really came Stronger, Faster, Higher, Together!!

title: Good CGI, good fight choreography, good plot, generally good entertainment.
text:
The length of the movie was just right. It positively surprised me in many places with a lot of new content, though it disappointed me in some aspects.It was better than most of the recent Marvel movies:"Ant-Man and the Wasp: Quantumania"
"Eternals"
"Thor: Love and Thunder"
"Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness"
"Black Widow"
I think many people will avoid 'The Marvels' because the previous Marvel movies in the new phase were not as good, which I find very unfortunate, because 'The Marvels' is really good.Actually, I also liked the first Captain Marvel movie.Once it lands on Disney+, people will appreciate this movie.

title: Good movie
text: Good movie, I love the character of captain Marvel and it was good movie. Marvel is going down with their content but now I think they can come back and I am waiting for the Avengers secret war. This movie contains alot of action and comedy so I think it is good for Marvel. I was waiting for this movie since it's trailer was released so I liked that movie the acting was awesome the character are good and I like those spirit of the characters to make this movie. Carol Danvers aka Captain Marvel has reclaimed her identity from the tyrannical Kree and taken revenge on the Supreme Intelligence. But unintended consequences see Carol shouldering the burden of a destabilized universe.

title: What a Marvel movie should be
text: The Marvels is exactly what a Marvel movie should be.It's super fun, exciting while also having depth and serious moments. It stands on it's own, it's perfectly enjoyable without having to see Ms Marvel or Secret Invasion but it doesn't let the fans down either: it has world building, character growth and it reflects on questions and problems presented in earlier MCU films, making it part of the ongoing narrative.I adored Kamala: Iman Vellani brings a contagious positive energy to the movie and you can't help but smile. I was thrilled that her family from Ms Marvel were featured more prominently than just a cameo appearence: they're so hilarious and loveable. All the main characters bring their A-game and their funny and heartfelt interactions are worth the price of the movie ticket alone.The movie is not only fun but insanely creative as well. The cartoon segment in the beginning sold me instantly and there are some really cool montages and shots in this that film students would drool over.It also has killer music and LOTS of adorable cats.

title: I don't get the hate
text: I thought this was a really good Marvel movie, with humor that hit home. Carol Danvers had a lot more charisma then she's shown so far, and Kamala was as lovable as she was in the show (even if overall the show was meh).Was it the best Marvel movie to date? Of course not. But it was a solid story that showed off it's main characters in a very good light and made me excited for Kamala's future in the MCU.And how can you hate the Moose (and company) sequence!? Maybe the water works sequence was cringe for some but I thought it was hilarious. The humor was well placed and didn't wear out it's welcome like in Love and Thunder.

title: Good family fun, better than expected
text: So many negative reviews here. I've seen criticism on that there's too much focus on funny stuff, on that there is a misconception on who's the target audience. It's not dark enough. Well, the target audience is family. It's family fun time. And it works. Nothing better than to sit in the cinema and sharing laughs and action with your kids. Marvel knows it and does everything right with The Marvels. Me and my 12 year old had an absolute blast. He has seen a lot and this is one of his top 3 favorites instantly. Sure, it's no 'Guardians' but does it have to be? Any negative reviewer would have probably loved it in their teens. They just grew up and became too old for it. Find your inner kid and enjoy this movie for what it is.

title: Honestly one of my new favorites,
text: I know that some people like super hero movies for it being really action packed, but this movie hit all the good spots. It was funny and had a good plot as well as had beautiful graphics. Some parts were definitely different from normal marvel movies but that's also what makes it interesting. I really like the chemistry that the characters had on stage and I really hope we can get more movies like that. I would say it you are a fan of marvel and of creative plots then this is the movie for you. I also love the ending and how it's not over till it's over. If you see this movie make sure that you watch till the end of the credits because something important happens that you will want to see. I am kind of confused about it though.

title: Cosmic!!
text: This movie is a solid 8 for me. It was really fun. Chemistry btw The 3 of them was marvellous. Action sequences and camera was awesome. It was really fast paced coz of the shorter duration which is both a good and bad thing. I wanted to see more of them and it all ended way too quickly but that doesn't stop this movie from being an entertainer. This movie also has a lot of connections and sets up the next movies. (unlike recent MCU films). Comedy scenes really worked out well. People r gonna hate this movie for all female cast. And it's supposed cool to hate things for no reason nowadays. I recommend to watch this movie in theatre and you wouldn't be disappointed.

title: And what do you really want from the movie?
text:
Soooo, really guys, what do you expect from the movie?Fun? Checked.Music? Checked.Action? Checked.Likeable actors? Checked.Space, colours, scenery? Checked.Crazy cats? ðŸ˜œ Checked. Lots of them ðŸ˜œ
THIS IS GOOD MOVIE!Movie is just a way to spend time. And this one is good at it. I knew that there's no Iron Man or Doctor Strange or Groot, but this movie doesn't need them to be good. Go to the theatre and enjoy.I know that I will watch it again.And I know that my English is not good enough, but I think that you understand me. Go to cinema and put that stars to value this movie. At least 8 or 9. From me they got 10 stars. They deserve it :)

title: great movie, about superhumans being human
text: Don't believe the MCU bros who don't want to see 3 women superheros. This movie was really exciting for fans of the comics, it was very funny, and the emotional tone was engrossing and satisfying. The themes of family and the challenges that the literal strongest humans in this universe face in being part of a family we're both meaningful and not forced. I'm excited for more movies with all these characters!If I have one critique it's a similar critique that I would give to many superhero movies, which is that the villain could have more complexity in their story arc. Otherwise, a marvelous movie!

title: I can only speak for myself. I absolutely loved it!!
text: I can only speak for myself. Not for others on this matter - because, that would be like "herding cats", pun intendedðŸ˜†. For me, I absolutely loved and enjoyed this movie. Sensed a touch of Disney-ness and, sorry, laughed my head off, especially at Carol's deadpan handling of those princess-ey moments. The franchise needed a new direction, something different (yet the same) and new doors open! That's what I've been crying for! And that's what I got! Why should I complain? No. I have no reason to complain. After the mega epic Endgame, like many, I too still wondered, where next... I see it now, this time, as I left the cinema. I just needed to relax, apply some objectivity and enjoy! I score this a nine, but it deserves no less than a 7.5 in my view.

title: The Cats Stole The Show
