text: The Marvels: At times the trio act like The Simpsons or maybe The Three Stooges but supply as many laughs as both of those in their prime. Well. It's all Carol Danvers' fault, after she destroyed rhe Supreme Intelligence, the Kree have a civil war which ecologically wrecks their home planet Hala and damages their sun (we learn this at the start). Dar-Benn, the new leader of the Kree, retrieves one of the Quantum Bands, of which Kamala Khan (Ms Marvel) has the other half. Dar-Benn harnesses the power of the Band to tear open a jump point in space. This causes damage The resulting anomaly is investigated by from separate sides by Monica Rambeau and Carol Danvers. When Rambeau touches the anomaly, she, Danvers, and Kamala switch places through teleportation. The switching causes the three to fight each others' Kree enemies. This results in some slapstick comedy scenes which also advance the narrative. How will they sort this out? Nick Fury is involved as well, so is the lovable cat who sprouts tentacles from his mouth and swallows the Kree leader's henchmen and many kittens appear.. The Skrull once again have to be rescued by the trio and Danvers learns lessons about her Great White Saviour Complex. We even get a planet where the inhabitants communicate through song, colourfully dressed like aliens from STOS or early episodes of STNG. Some great battle scenes and one to combat, all delivers with a soupcon of humour. Not the greatest of the Marvel films (this is the 33rd film in the Marvel Cinematic Universe (MCU)). But well worth watching. Directed by Nia DaCosta, who co-wrote the screenplay with Megan McDonnell and Elissa Karasik. 7.5/10.

title: Marvel is back!
text: Like many people I have struggled with Marvel in a post-endgame world. It seems to have had a lot of stumbles in the movie department. While the TV shows were consistently good, the movies were inconsistent at best. After Thor 4 and Doctor Strange 2 I really started to give up and enjoyable movies like Guardians 3 seemed few and far between.That being said, for the first time since Endgame, I finally have hope for future movies thanks to The Marvels. It was funny, chaotic, exciting and definitely felt like I was back watching top tier Marvel movies.Do you have to have seen the tv shows to understand it? Yes. But this is Marvel! It's not a new thing that to enjoy some of the movies you have to have seen the stuff leading up to it. That's the whole point of the Marvel Cinematic Universe, it's a whole universe packed full with characters and stories.10/10 a really enjoyable movie!!

title: SO MUCH HEART!!!!
text: I saw The Marvels at my local Regal theater.On a scale of One to Five Stars I give THE MARVELS 1000 Stars!!!I was constantly cheering and excitedly stomping my legs during this movie.My heart grew 1000 sizes while watching this.I love these characters and I loved them together.Ms. Marvel is absolutely the heart of the film, but Monica Rambeau and Carol Danvers were also great. I spent the whole movie wishing we had lots more of both of these characters in the MCU.The Kahn family were also great. Funny for sure, but also supportive. And helpful. And Goose the cat was also a delight.And all of the future teases...This was all of the fun and more.I probably have to see this again tomorrow after work!

title: Light hearted fun
text: Everyone these days is looking for soul crushing sequels that stand up to infinity war and endgame but don't realize those were made to end an Era. This movie has laughs, fun, action and family. Thoroughly enjoyed the film. Could it have gone without the singing planet? Yes. But the heart was there and "the Marvels" made a great team. Bringing Kamala in to bring some lightheartedness to captain marvels arc was a great choice and Iman knocks this character out of the park. All the ladies did a great job, and Fury was on point as always. Looking forward to see how they tie the post credit scene into the future of the universe.

title: Only 4-5 cringe worthy moments in the middle
text: It's was funny, charming, and the cast all seemed to have great chemistry.I really enjoyed it, laughs- so many laughs. Samuel L Jackson and the Khan family really brought the fun.There's 4-5 cringe worthy minutes in the middle that I'll be skipping once I can watch at home. But, those minutes aside I really enjoyed it. FYI way better than Love & Thunder, the world most awkward thrust in the Eternals, and I even better than Antman 3.I will add though, if Marvel wants to do a young avengers they better get a wiggle on cause all these "kids" will be older than the Stranger Things kids will be when they graduate High School.

title: Had so much fun
text: The hate this movie got was totally uncalled for. Now, this movie won't be for everyone. It's goofy and stupid at times and it doesn't match the heights of other marvel entries but that being said, it's fun. I went with my friend and we were laughing our asses off the entire time. I had a blast and I would definitely watch it again. "He's bilingual" had me laughing for days. Also the Brie Larson hate is just stupid. She had two of the funniest lines in the movie, and I can agree that Captain Marvel is a bit stiff in the first movie, but that's why this one was so much fun. It was a completely different side to Carol. Aside from that, Iman Velani stole the show. Kamala was the highlight of the movie. The ending with Monica is very interesting and I'm looking forward to seeing what that develops into.

title: A Wonderful Movie with Strong Leads
text: TL;DR: A wonderful movie that I absolutely recommend to any Marvel fan!I loved this movie from start to finish. It was fantastic to see Carol Danvers back in her element, and I loved the chemistry between Brie Larson, Iman Vellani and Teyonah Parris. You could really tell how much they loved working together, and the three characters brought together made for a fantastic storyline! I went in a group of seven people, and not a single one of us was disappointed with the movie. I was also very excited to see two appearances from two of my favorite characters that I will not name here to avoid spoilers.Seeing so many strong female characters in one movie was fantastic, and I'm very excited to see where Marvel takes their stories next!

title: I liked it.
text: This movie did well to set the stage for a future, female-led Avengers-type movie. I think the Captain Marvel series gets unfair criticism because it's telling the story from a woman's perspective and geared towards the MCU's female fan base. This movie is no exception. IMO, Marvel has historically done an awful job with the multiverse concept. In past films, it failed to build on the logic from the "What if...?" series by focusing less on a coherent storyline and more on trying to top itself. This movie however did well by going with a simpler and more entertaining storyline. It humorously uses some of the self-effacng sarcasm that was in Iron Man. It also did a good job showing the way the super heros resolve conflict while utilizing their unique powers without stepping on each other's toes. Unlike other MCU multiverse-oriented movies, I'm looking forward to the next one in this series.

title: Light, Fun, Entertaining, Relaxing, everything a comic book movie should be
text: Stop overthinking it. This was a fun movie in the spirit of the original Ant Man movie. So much wonder and joy over their powers and abilities. I usually agree with the MCU fan masses on reviews, but not this time. Marvel spoiled us through End Game with such a variety of movies that brought funny and dark all together. People expect that in every movie now instead of appreciating the individuality of each movie. I would have liked more character building and story from this movie but again I say it was a building block like the first MCU set of movies with original Ant Man, Thor, IronMan,etc. I am ready for more Marvels!

title: Such a blast
text: This film was such a blast! So many laugh out loud moments and a whirl of a time. The fight scenes were so well choreographed with all these ladies!Also, absolutely amazing to have all female leads, a female villain, female director, and a primarily female crew. The credits alone were inspiring!We need more films with new and fresh faces and I truly hope that the audiences come out for this one.Of the films, this one also requires the least backstory. This is a fantastic entry point for new fans.Telling all my family and friends to see this film!Also, for the cat lover, you're in for some fun scenes with Goose.

title: The Marvels Going Higher, Further, Faster!
text: Exceptional performance by Brie Larson, Teyonah Parris and Iman Vellani as Carol Danvers / Captain Marvel, Monica Rambeau and Kamala Khan / Ms. Marvel respectively. Samuel L. Jackson is back with a fury as Nick Fury and bringing the much-needed energy and comic relief as usual.I highly encourage watching the following Marvel movies and TV series in order to thoroughly prepare for The Marvels:The Marvels' storyline picks up right after each of the main stars' respective storylines and manages to combine their story arc into a unique and marvelous manner, keeping it consistent with some of the current events within the broad Marvel Cinematic Universe and developing our heroes from individual stars into a team of superstars. The costumes are aesthetically pleasing.Zawe Ashton plays the part of Dar-Benn, the antagonist in The Marvels. I would have loved to see more of her character's backstory and hope that we get to see more backgrounds being unpacked either through Marvel TV Series or even an television special.The movie's runtime is 105 minutes, making it the shortest Marvel movie in the Marvel Cinematic Universe. The story felt a little bit rushed, considering a dangerous mission is underway to prevent world-level ramifications but no-time is wasted to deliver yet another masterpiece in the cinematic universe.The story delivers a few unique twists, lots of humor and a few surprises. The movie definitely contains something for everyone, young and old, and I encourage you to take the whole family to experience The Marvels.The Marvels is a story that keeps the golden thread, which is the Marvel Cinematic Universe, and still manages to peak higher, further and faster into the multiversal trajectory.The trailer doesn't spoil much, but as always, a secret awaits for those who eagerly pay attention to the Marvel's trailers. My only worry is that usually key spoilers tend to emerge in the week following the release of the movie in the forms of updated sneak peaks and mini-trailers.There is a mid-credits scene that you don't want to miss, but no post-credits scene.I rate this movie 8 out of 10. Really excited to see what the future holds for Captain Marvel.Watch at a cinema near you!

title: Girl Power! Great action and great laughs!
text: So, I absolutely loved this movie, and my family did too. We loved the laughs, the action, the ladies coming together and fighting together, the connection between Ms Marvel, WandaVision, and Captain Marvel, and everything in between. It wasn't Guardians of the Galaxy 3 or even as complex as Loki, but it certainly wasn't the worst, and I'd say that's a bit dramatic to say so. It definitely gave a light, fun, and humorous take on MCU content that maybe the latest movies were too serious to do so. I think this movie was like an introduction to The Marvels and did an amazing job doing just that. Great job ladies on this movie, and I'd definitely watch it again.

title: Blends Teamwork, Girl Power, Comedy And Emotion With Action-Adventure And Positive Themes
text: While it is far from perfect, The Marvels is a captivating film filled with adventure and laughter. It has unexpected twists and turns around every corner that help make it an entertaining movie.The Marvels centers around members of the Avengers. Carol Danvers (Brie Larson), better known as Captain Marvel, has found herself and her superpowers linked with Monica Rambeau (Teyonah Parris) and new teenage superhero Kamala Khan (Iman Vellani), aka Miss Marvel. These three powerful women must team up to stop Dar-Benn (Zawe Ashton), the ruler of a struggling civilization who has set her eyes on taking resources from thriving planets. However many secrets about Carol's past resurface as they do so.Iman Vellani's performance as Kamala Khan overpowers the movie with a new side of joy to the MCU. Her explosive personality bursts through the screen as a huge highlight throughout the entire film. I love her character as she brings it to life with a passion. There are so many insane plot twists throughout the film and, while most are a great addition to the plot, a few get a little too crazy for my liking; though they aren't wild enough to drag the movie down. I enjoyed the plot being based around three strong women who are in charge. It's something not seen as often in superhero movies, especially in the past, but the MCU has been doing it a lot recently and it's very empowering. My favorite part of the movie is towards the beginning when Monica, Kamala and Carol first discover their powers have been entangled and they find themselves fighting soldiers in three different places and switching back and forth between locations throughout the battle. It's super fun to watch and my eyes were glued to the screen.The message of The Marvels is that true friends and family will love you and always be there for you no matter what. Carol learns this throughout the movie as she sometimes worries about what the people who care for her will think about her past; eventually, she accepts that they will love her for who she is now and not what she's done before.I give The Marvels 4 out of 5 stars and recommend it for ages 12 to 18, plus adults. It releases in theaters November 10, 2023.By Kendall B., KIDS FIRST!

title: Fun and just fine
text: Formulaic plot like all recent Marvel movies. But who watches these for the plot?It was a much better production than some of the recent output. The CGI was mostly good, the music was well chosen, the editing and costuming was good. It's was just good.The reason to watch this was the cast. The three leads are all great actors, the chemistry is good and none overpowers the others to steal scenes. It felt like a real ensamble piece in a way marvel hasn't put out in a while.In terms of wider marcel universe I don't think this will end up being important, but it was a low stakes fun movie. It's not trying to win a best picture oscar, it's just trying to be a popcorn movie. And it nails that.As a caveat, I will say the only truly bad looking effect in the whole movie is the character you'll see in a post credit sequence.

title: What a superhero movie has to be
text: This movie was simply said, a superhero movie. Was it world changing? Not really, but you know what? I enjoyed that. It was funny, it had characters go through growth that a twelve year old needs to hear as a lesson and in the end that's the main target group; 12 year old needs and if I was a 12 year old nerd I would be in love with this movie.The design was once again very marvellous, very colorful and fun to watch, the characters were really enjoyable because they were realistic, the acting was whatever you'd assume from a Superhero movie, the lines were sometimes a little bit cringe, there were no huge hard scenes to act so I can't comment on that. What I can comment on is the action and they really nailed that, I greatly enjoyed the different approach to fighting scenes for once.One thing that I think people leave out of mind when they comment on the movie, is that this was the beginning. You can't compare this to endgame (which has been a build up movie, 20 movies have lead up to that one) and it's impossible to do the same thing with this new movie, for a build up movie it was really good though and I'm looking forward to see more movies like this.

title: A superpowered spectacle that soars
text: The Marvels is a thrilling superhero film that follows the interconnected stories of three powerful women: Carol Danvers, a.k.a. Captain Marvel; Kamala Khan, a Pakistani-American teenager with shape-shifting abilities; and Monica Rambeau, a former Air Force pilot with photon-manipulating powers. As they navigate their own challenges, their paths converge in an epic battle against a formidable enemy, testing their strength, resilience, and the power of unity.The film's openness to representation and diversity reflects the changing nature of superhero stories. It celebrates the strength and complexity of its female protagonists, offering a refreshing departure from traditional male-dominated superhero stories. The inclusion of Kamala Khan, Marvel's first Muslim character to headline a comic book series, adds a significant cultural dimension to the narrative and will resonate with audiences seeking authentic and inclusive representation.The plot weaves together personal journeys, cosmic conflicts, and the enduring spirit of heroism. It explores questions of self, agency, and the consequences of one's actions. The tone strikes a balance between exhilarating action sequences and heartfelt moments, capturing the essence of Marvel's trademark blend of spectacle and emotional depth.Brie Larson, Iman Vellani, and Teyonah Parris deliver compelling performances, infusing their characters with depth and charisma. Larson's portrayal of Captain Marvel exudes confidence and vulnerability, while Vellani's Kamala Khan brings infectious energy and relatability to the screen. Parris shines as Monica Rambeau, embodying resilience and determination. The film's leading actors have great chemistry, which makes for an interesting and lively group performance.Director Nia DaCosta brings a distinct visual style to the film, blending dynamic camerawork with stunning special effects. The cosmic landscapes and high-octane action sequences are brought to life with breathtaking cinematography, immersing us in the grandeur of the Marvel universe. Stunning visuals are produced through the expert blending of practical and digital effects.The film's soundtrack complements the narrative, enhancing pivotal moments with evocative musical cues. The editing maintains a brisk pace, propelling the story forward while allowing poignant beats to resonate. The balance between kinetic action and introspective character moments is skilfully maintained, ensuring a highly enjoyable viewing experience.The film's exploration of female empowerment and solidarity is powerful, offering a timely and inspiring message. The dynamic interplay between the central characters, coupled with the film's visual splendour, creates an immersive and emotionally resonant journey.While The Marvels excels in its portrayal of multifaceted female protagonists and its visual spectacle, certain plot elements may feel familiar to seasoned superhero enthusiasts, and the pacing occasionally rushes through character development. But The Marvels is a must-see for fans of superhero cinema, offering a potent blend of action, heart, and representation. The film's positive message and excellent acting make it a welcome addition to the MCU canon. With its exhilarating visuals and compelling characters, The Marvels is a superpowered spectacle that soars.

title: Funny and exhilarating
text: Way more fun than the recent overblown MCU tripe (Multiverse/Quantumania/Guardians3). Yes, it helps to have seen the Ms. Marvel series to get the full context on Kamala Khan and her family.What I saw was a fast-paced, funny, and somewhat emotional movie. Each character gets a chance to shine, and the various worlds and setups had me laughing out loud.Personally, I've disliked the incessant push towards the next big bad (Kang/multiverse). The early MCU thrived on character-development, building a story for each hero, so that when the Avengers finally Assembled, it meant something.With The Marvels, MCU has a fast-paced, funny, action-packed, character-driven gem. Kamala and her family are hysterical, Monica Rambeau is trying to find her place, and Carol Danvers works through some hidden emotional baggage to tie them all together.No, this is not a manly, testosterone-laden big boom movie. Nor is it high, artful cinema. Too much of the recent MCU takes itself too seriously. Instead, The Marvels is a fun romp, with meaningful characters and some fantastic absurdity.

title: Pretty fun, cat parents will love it
text: Don't expect anything game changing from this movie, but please go in with an open mind and you'll enjoy it.There's a few legit hilarious scenes and Goose the flerken steals the show. I think I actually like this movie better than the Captain Marvel solo movie, as I don't enjoy the character that much on her own. The interaction with the other characters is better than expected and I especially enjoyed Kamala's youthful enthusiasm. Anyone who has cats will really love a scene towards the end of the movie!In conclusion I don't really understand the hate for this movie. People just seem to dislike Brie Larson?

title: Fun
text: The team up was great. Who can resist that kid's energy? I loved this and my 9YO could watch it and loved it.We have been looking forward to this since the first peak at the Flurkin kittens and it didn't disappoint. The story made sense without laboring the backstory or individual traumas. It also answered questions left by some of the Disney+ series.If I had any complaint, I think they could have developed the villain more. You understand her issue but you don't care. The Cree are zealots or scared bystanders and the bad guy is just unredeemable. . Her crew seems like there is more there but you don't see it.

title: Tons of fun and Character
text: This felt like the most polished and complete MCU movie in years. It felt like a throwback to Phase 2.The plot is fast and thin, but all that saved time goes into letting the outstanding cast SHINE through their wonderful characters. Their individual and intertwined stories are where it's at, thanks much more to the tremendous charisma and chemistry of the stars (including especially the typical underserved villain) than the script. The script is adequate.And the action and humor and sheer SPECTACLE were all TOP NOTCH which is where this film distinguishes itself from most of that we've seen the past several years. And of course there are the stingers which finally give a fan genuine reason to be excited for the overall franchise going forward.

title: Remember Fun? That's What This Movie Is
text: The Marvels is just the movie for the time. There is no big continuity requirement, no MASSIVE run time, no gut-wrenching sorrow. It's just fun. Nia DaCosta delivered an entertaining film with a witty story by herself, Elissa Karasik, and. Megan McDonnell. Brie Larson and Teyonah Parris do the heavy dramatic lifting but Iman Vellani brings the heart and is a worthy spring-green-bright-eyed-hero successor to Peter Parker. But the real delight here is Zawe Ashton. Her villain, Dar-Benn is is just a blast. Ashton could be excused for clocking in, collecting her check, and moving on. Instead she is having fun and so are we.I've heard there are some negative reviews. Some harsh comments, even. I grew up reading the comics. This movie is a slice of delight and DaCosta takes us to worlds beyond even the fancy of deadline-pressed panel artists.No, the Marvels is not perfect. But with more heart than the Multiverse of Madness and better balance than Love and Thunder, The Marvels does rank with Guardians 3 as the best Marvel film since Avengers Infinity War.In short, it's a lot of fun and that's what we need just now. Check it out.

title: Surprisingly good!
text: My wife wanted to see this movie and honestly I wasn't very excited, we're both huge marvel fans, but I'm just not a big Captain Marvel fan, so I wasn't expecting much. But honestly, I really liked it. It was charming, clever, really funny, and the story was refreshingly simple unlike some other Marvel movies where the heroes are always trying to save the whole entire universe. The story was a little more compact. It definitely has that "girl power" vibe, which didn't feel out of place. It felt very natural and not forced. I was very entertained throughout the entire film and didn't get bored at all. And the stinger at the end had me VERY excited.

title: This was a fun movie
text: Why all the hate? I can't figure that out at all. I really enjoyed this film.Iman Vellani really steals the show with her charm, and the people playing her family had just the right amount of love and fear to make their contribution to the movie worthwhile.The effects were markedly better than Quantumania, the story was (kind of) about space aliens killing planets... but still seemed more grounded than Wakanda Forever, and it was easier to follow than Dr Strange MoM. This was better than all of these.Negatives... the villain was meh. But the story wasn't about that so much as it was about each of the main characters and their journeys.Can't wait to see it again.

title: It's a great movie!!
text: For me, I enjoyed watching this movie. It's a fun, action-packed movie that I believe a lot of people would enjoy~ For the most part, I think Marvel is finally going in the right direction this time, given that their recent releases be it tv series or movies had been somewhat above average only. But hey, they've put a lot of hardwork in these movies/series that's why the best thing we could do is to just sit back, watch, enjoy and appreciate. The best thing I loved about The Marvels is that they've introduced something new to their audience in terms of action scenes. They've really been creative for this movie. Kudos to them!

title: This was pretty good
text: I'm tired of all the haters! This Marvel movie is better than the last few. It was action packed. It tied in Wandavison and Ms Marvel into the Marvels. It hinted the Young Avengers was coming. You even got a surprise in the post credits. It was better than the last Antman, Thor, and Eternals movies. I really didn't like Secret Invasion and She-Hulk. So you have an understanding of where I'm coming from. Just because you have a female lead cast don't mean it will suck. The Marvels was way better than Captain Marvel in my opinion. I hope they have more adventures because they made a great team. So watch it!

title: It was a fun, entertaining super hero movie
text: Please don't let all the snark and whining about this film scare you! It was great. It's a fun, fast paced, action packed, classic comic book type movie that doesn't take itself too seriously. It's also grounded with a ton of heart. In many ways, each Marvel is coming to terms with who they are. I was throughly engaged with the characters. The three Marvels are very charming and endearing, and I cannot wait to see more of them individually and together. The movie actually made me laugh and smile, as opposed to the overly heavy, dark, depressing, and broody movies that have dominated the MCU for over a decade. And the Khan family is great. Watch The Marvels on a Friday or Saturday night with popcorn, relax and be entertained! Tip: It helps to have watched the movies and TV shows that lead into it - Captain Marvel, Wandavision, and Ms. Marvel before watching this (which I had). It's time for Marvel movies to be fun again, which this undoubtedly is! Watch for yourself and enjoy!

title: Light, Fun and Some Nice Surprises
text: Is it Ragnarok? No, it's not. It does spark joy though. I had a great time seeing it in theater. The MCU "lovers" need to get over the fact that not every movie is going to be a banger in this universe. The comic relief was a bit over the top at times but it was driven by a teenager so it probably tracks. I thought The Marvel's relationship was great. Good acting as the emotional moments did envoke feelings. Length of the movie was good. Kept the action going and didn't draw out any character interactions.Overall, great addition to the MCU. I'll happily watch this again and hope Brie Larson continues to get a chance to bring her take on the character to the big screen.

title: What's with all the hate?
text: I will be the first to agree that Marvel movies have been pretty bad of late, but this was refreshingly good in my opinion. I thought the jokes were good and I enjoyed the story. I laughed genuinely at the jokes meant times and Ms. Marvel was especially good in this. The action was enjoyable as well. I didn't know what people expect here, it's a superhero movie not an gripping drama. Maybe it's become trendy to trash Marvel of late? I don't know but this is the best Marvel movie of the last several years for sure. Just go see it with an open mind and not preconceived notions of it being bad. I think the majority of reviews are on the positive side. Ignore the haters.

title: Love Marvel Long Time
text: I watched it November 10th with my family and i absolutely loved it! Super fun and captivating. The marvels brought me immense joy by seeing Kamala Khan and Monica Rambeau on the big screen. Iman's portrayal adds a delightful touch to the movie, capturing the essence of the character perfectly. The filmmakers wisely avoided overusing her character, allowing her to shine without overshadowing the storyline.I appreciate how they depicted her realistically as a kid in the midst of war or battling a major villain. The movie introduces intriguing elements to the MCU, creating anticipation for future developments and contributing to an exciting overarching narrative.I look forward to what Marvel has in store. Despite biases, it's essential to recognize that everyone has their own story, and Marvel consistently excels at bringing comics to life.To those wondering whether to watch it, I strongly recommend it! Disregard negative reviews; conveying hate is often easier than expressing praise. Critics of this movie likely weren't Marvel fans to begin with and are merely joining a bandwagon they claim to reject, yet here they are, commenting at the end of the day.I typically don't write reviews, but the unwarranted hate this movie receives compelled me to speak out. I encourage other quiet fans like me to share their positive experiences and not let the naysayers ruin the Marvel experience for us.

title: surprisingly good fun
text: Well that certainly was no Thor 4 or Antman 3. Not even the type of issues that plagued wakanda forever. It did have some less heinous issues, but I'm surprised at the reactions. I'm thinking it could be that ms marvel and Wanda vision are required prerequisites. Also, the background of the antagonist is left til halfway through whereas I believe it really should be a prologue. Also some cuts are tonally clashing and really undercuts the emotions. There are plenty of lines that should be cut and some things which are foreshadowed that don't come to fruition. It's not perfect by any means, but I did enjoy it for the most part and it doesn't seem to suffer from 'the formula'. I really do wonder what are the major issues some other people are having, because I just didn't see the issues I've heard repeated by many different people.

title: Outstanding Fun and Interesting Story that ushers in the next generation of Avengers!
text: I loved this movie! It is exactly what it should be: a story about 3 women or people trying to figure out how to work together to achieve something greater given their different abilities. I'm sorry other viewers didn't have the same experience and rated the movie negatively. This movie not only tells an uplifting story of how teamwork can achieve greater results, it ushers in the next generation of the Avengers team, as Ms. Marvel and Captain Rambeau experience a greater introduction to the MCU. There are moments of levity and moments of heaviness in the story that keep viewers engaged throughout.

title: I need more Kamala
text: The Marvels shines brightly in the superhero genre, primarily due to Kamala's exceptional debut. She brings a delightful mix of humor, innocence, and mindfulness, refreshing qualities that add depth to the typically short-sighted heroes of the franchise. Her presence is a beacon of charm and complexity, elevating every scene. This magnetic energy is not just confined to the movie; it extends to her Disney show, sparking excitement in our family to explore more of her journey. Kamala is a standout character, infusing 'The Marvels' with a unique spirit that's both entertaining and thought-provoking.

title: The Marvels
text: I could not love this movie more.The entire family enjoyed every minute of it. The humor was on point, the reasoning behind the villain's actions was valid, and, of course, we can't forget Goose.Goose was busy.I ignored the naysayers; I wanted to watch the movie and form my own opinion, and I am I did so. I enjoyed Ms. Marvel's show; she's an incredible addition. The banter between everyone was great. People need to keep an open mind and just enjoy the movie. It's not that serious. And the beef people have with Captain Marvel is weird. The actress is awesome.I can't wait to see where this new Marvel Universe goes.

title: Short and Sweet
text: Just finished watching The Marvels and I can saw I thoroughly enjoyed this movie. After an endless stream of MCU projects since Infinity Stones, that just seemed like the director was trying to hit the same emotions that Marvel fans had during the OG avengers. This movie is not trying to win an Oscar, it is trying to entertain and it definitely did that. It kept my 4 and 6 year old, as well as my husband and I, fully engaged.It was fun, it was at times silly, but it also had great action sequences. Ms Marvel/Kamala Khan was wonderfully portrayed and was the perfect counterpoint to the seriousness of Captain Marvel and Monica Rambeau.This is a movie that I would gladly watch again and I will definitely be purchasing when it is released.

title: Just Plain Fun!
text: It's a blast from start to finish. Larson as Carol Danvers aka Captain Marvel brings a lot of emotion in a very smart subtle way. Parris does a lot with her time in the role of Monica and I hope to see more of her in the future. Vellani's Kamala Khan has a bright eyed, and most importantly, enthusiastic energy that starts off as a mild irritation to both Carol and Monica but becomes an endearing emotional catharsis by the end of the film for them both.The action is very well framed and there are some great moments that legitimately made me say "whoa" with how clever they are. On top of this there are several laugh out loud moments. The villain doesn't get too much character development, but frankly this is The Marvels showcase and it works well enough to understand the stakes.Overall it's just so much fun. There's a lot I didn't expect or predict which is a great thing to have this late in the MCU. Plus shout out to Goose!

title: Marvels is a must!
text: This was a wonderfully weird entanglement of 3 distinct styles of stories that I am absolutely here for! A quick pinball ride through space with characters that are fun, but that still manage to have poignant emotional beats. Teyonah Parris did a wonderful job making vaguely scientific alphabet soup sound convincing, Brie Larson's Captain Marvel is still one of my favorite underrated performances in the MCU, and Iman Vellani continues to be an absolute blast to watch! I'd gladly watch another movie with this team mashup. If nothing else, watch it for the impromptu escape scene involving space kittens and an apt Broadway number.

title: Not a new direction for the MCU but not a disaster either.
text: I'm not sure I've ever seen a film release surrounded by so much hyperbole and people losing their minds.I do understand that phase 4 of the MCU has been pretty poor with so many projects and it's definitely lost the relative consistency of quality it used to have.Just this year GotG 3 was one of marvels best I personally thought Love and Thunder was not that bad pretty average MCU even if Christian bale was wasted but I'll admit antman 3 was a big disappointment that I didn't enjoy.That was a stupidly long intro when I don't have that much to say about this film, it was fine not brilliant definitely not the worst film released this year as I've seen it called.The most important part of the film which is the main trios chemistry was pretty solid and Kamala Khan and her family were the highlight throughout having almost all the jokes that I found funny coming from them.Overall the villain was forgettable but not awful the action was ok, all round an ok film with some better parts.Both of the more bizarre/weird scenes I enjoyed a lot and I do think if they don't land for you that could impact your enjoyment a decent bit.Wouldn't recommend to everyone but if you've enjoyed a decent number of marvel films I think you'll enjoy this one.

title: Unexpectedly Entertaining
text: Heading into "The Marvels," I wasn't expecting much, especially after the letdowns in Phase 4 of the MCU.But man, was I surprised! This movie was a total blast, reminding me of the fun vibes from "Thor: Ragnarok" and the first two "Guardians of the Galaxy" films.The movie is a neat 1 hour and 40 minutes, which is just right - it gets in, does its thing, and doesn't drag on.The real star here is Iman Vellani. She absolutely owns her role and carries the whole film on her shoulders. Her performance is so spot-on that it makes the whole thing work.Now, the writing? It's kind of goofy, and the whole movie doesn't take itself too seriously. It's clear nobody was trying to make some deep, meaningful statement - they were just out to make a fun movie. And they totally nailed it.Bottom line: "The Marvels" is the most fun I've had watching a Marvel movie since the last Avengers. It's not heavy or complicated, just a great, entertaining watch for anyone looking to enjoy some superhero action.

title: Reall fun but flawed
text:
The Marvels (2023)
First off, the best CBM (comic book movie) in 2023 remains Across The Spiderverse (my favourite live action CBM remains GotG3).But The Marvels is a really fun, action packed film that had us laughing throughout. Really enjoyed the fight sequence choreography in particular. This film also looks good (except 1 "Superman" flying scene at the start).For the first time since Shang Chi & No Way Home in 2020, there were great cameos that actually helped make it feel like part of the greater connected universe something that's been sorely lacking in the MCU since 2020. Yes Dr Strange had cameos, but most of those were nothing more.However, there's a scene about 60% into this rather short, quick paced film that feels superfluous & wholly unnecessary: a singing, colourful "Disney" esque planet, which pulled me out of the film completely.And I can understand the desire to tap into the K Drama, K Pop world's recent surge in popularity, but Park Seo Joon (What's Wrong with Secretary Kim, Itaewon Class) can't speak English, and it shows.Ok Taecyeon (Vincenzo, Bring it on Ghost), Ahn Hyo-seop (Abyss, Business Proposal, A Time Called You) are both fluent in English. Heck, Song Joong Ki's English would have sufficed.Finally, it's absolutely baffling that a problem Captain Marvel solves at the end, the short solution somehow escaped her realization for 30 years??Despite these complaints, this is a really fun, face paced but flawed film. Brie Larsen isn't given enough to do, Teyonah Paris *is* Monica, but Iman Vellani steals the show.8.3/10, B+

title: Those hating on this film need to move on
text: The film is great fun. It's fast paced, action packed and comedic in all the right places. Yes, sometimes the pace could actually do with being slowed down to add a bit of character depth but...honestly I think a lot of the bad reviews on here are from people that need to accept the new reality and embrace it. The ladies rocked in this movie and I loved the dynamic of all 3. If this was a Thor movie people would be raving about it but we love to try and destroy something new.I hope people go to the cinema and see this movie, it deserves much more credit and many more seats filled than these reviews will warrant it.Honestly go see it for yourself, then adopt a Flurken!

title: Don't listen to the haters
text: Honestly don't know what movie the haters were watching.This movie was fun and gives more hints at what's to come not only in marvel movies but also of a tv series.Without giving spoiler it was an interesting dynamic between the three heroes carol showed emotions for the first time and we learn more about who Monica actually is and their relationship. But it's Kamala Khan and her family that steal the show and had me laughing and close to tears in equal measure. The story overall helps us understand the wider universe and hints towards what's to come.The Kamala Khan end scene also has me really excited to see what will happen from that.Overall a fun movie with an exciting and emotional story.

title: The movie was A LOT more fun than the first
text: The Marvels was a pleasant improvement on the first film. The pacing of the movie is it's biggest problem, as it does move very fast and really tries to cover a lot of ground while doing so, but it definitely builds and answers questions asked on the first Captain Marvel film.As far as the overall story Marvel is building this movie FINALLY does something to give this "Phase" SOME direction, which has been lacking as of late. This movie is still a story existing in a bigger story, but it's far less hallow than its predecessor.MS. MARVEL is the star of this movie and she really shines in every scene. They definitely built on the feel and energy of the Ms Marvel show and added that spice to this project.Would definitely recommend checking this movie out, just know it's a story connecting to another story to come, so it will leave you wanting more.

title: It's a lot of fun!
text: Great film to watch with your family. The plot is very good, with a villain that has something else on their mind that just power. The chemistry between the three main characters is great. The script is full of silly jokes that make you laugh out loud more than once. Action scenes are also very well choreographed. It seems like a good change of gears for the MCU. I really hope that we get some more like this in the near future. It's not just a superhero movie, there are some deeper meaning under that comic. It's more about how to open to people you care about, and how that makes you stronger rather than weaker.

title: Simply fun and unconvoluted
text: While much of this story feels rushed & the villain feels generic, that's not the point. It's just a fun team-up movie. Unlike the Avengers, this focuses on female heroes that are very different but have to find a way to quickly become a cohesive unit & a second family to each other, The break-out is Ms Marvel/Kamala Khan. Being a fangirl and meeting her idol is exciting to watch because who hasn't wanted to meet their hero? On top of that, how cool would it be to fight alongside your hero? Kamala's tv series established her as a geeky kid with superpowers - how could you not root for someone like that? I want more of this team going forward!

title: Funny, lighthearted carried by Iman Vellani
text: I really enjoyed watching this movie. It was one of those movies that is like basically carried by a single actress. Iman Valini was really funny and spectacular and all her jokes were really funny and she was shining in every scene. I like that the movie was about empowering women all the superheroes and villains were women, and we need more movies like this.On the downside, some aspects of this movie felt a bit rushed such as the villain. I don't think there was enough backstory about the villain. Usually in marvel, they make us care about the villain, but in this scenario, I found myself not caring at all just because it just feels like a big bad villain that needed to be stopped as opposed to someone with a goal and values on the agenda.Moreover, Carol Danvers was good as usual but in some things she felt like she didn't really want to be there at least that's how it felt like it.All in all, it was a really funny, lighthearted movie carried by Eman Valini, and her family, with some noticeable shortcomings mainly related to the villain and Carol Danvers performance.

title: Better than other reviews indicated
text: The original Captain Marvel movie is my third favorite Marvel movie, behind only Infinity War and Winter Soldier, and though The Marvels is not it's equal, it is a fun movie and is clearly going to be a linchpin pin introducing the next phase of movies and tv series.The acting is great, with Brie Larson perfectly portraying the character of Carol Danvers (Captain Marvel); the studio could not have picked a better actress for that part than her.The story briefly dipped into the realm of silliness a couple of times, but my issues with them are minor and easy to overlook, particularly since one of them contained a beautiful song and dance routine.I recommend seeing this movie on the big screen in 3D and I also intend to buy it.

title: MCU is back on track
text: With The Marvels MCU is back on track! I was getting disappointed with the Multiverse saga, with Thor being the only somewhat solid movie in it. But this one finally has all good ingredients which were successfully used many times in the first saga: unexpected humor, often coming from comparing the fantastic with the ordinary life, personal moments, moments of joy and moments of sadness, great sci-fi visuals, a villain whom we can sympathize, semi-complex but logical plot. The connections with previous movies and series come just in time to link some open ends in the saga. I would say that it is harder and harder to keep MCU movies self-contained and they are becoming more of episodes of a bigger story. To me this is a plus and if one has the background, they could see in a small scene or in a single line a lot more than what can be expressed with hundreds of words. It is actually becoming marvellous!I do not understand this wave of negative reviews. Is it a campaign against Marvel? Or are people's expectations very high after Infinity War and Endgame? A movie based on comics has to be comic in the first place! And if we add some sci-fi, attempted to be somehow "scientifically" explained, and add a few personal stories, we receive a good Marvel product. As a conclusion, The Marvels is as fresh as the GOTG 1 plus it develops the Multiverse saga. Nuff said!

title: The Marvels is a spectacular superhero movie!
text: The Marvels is a comic book movie through and through and I mean that in a good way. My favorite superhero movies are those that tell a good and interesting story using drama, fantasy along with some humor and the Marvels hits all of those marks in a fantastic way.The movie stars Brie Larson as Carol Danvers / Captain Marvel, Teyonah Parris as Monica Rambeau, and Iman Vellani as Kamala Khan / Ms. Marvel, and the great Samuel L. Jackson as Nick Fury.There is great chemistry between the three lead actresses and Iman Vellani truly shines as Ms. Marvel. Brie Larson is an amazing actress and she makes the penultimate and quintessential Captain Marvel, a role she was born to play. Teyonah Parris as Monica Rambeau is amazing and the relationship she has with Captain Marvel and the issues the two bring to the movieq are well examined and form the core of this movie's heart and souls.Samuel L. Jackson reprises his role as Nick Fury. Every single movie that Samuel L. Jackson is in, is made 10x better just because he is in it. The Marvels is no exception. This version of Nick Fury is a bit more fun and light-hearted and is a refreshing addition to the movie.Zawe Ashton is excellent as Dar-Benn and a worthy opponent to the Marvels. Dar-Benn is the Kree leader who is trying to restore her homeland after a civil war, a civil war sparked by Captain Marvel after she unleashed retribution for how she had been treated in the first film, and how the Kree unjustly treated the Skrull for many years. As for all good villains, Dar-Benn sparks some empathy toward her motives even though in the end those motives are destructive.My only negative toward this movie is how underutilized is Zenobia Shroff as Muneeba Khan: Kamala's mother. In Ms. Marvel, Zenobia Shroff stole the show as Kamala's controlling but very loving mother. We do get that here in the Marvels I just wanted more. They say the best acting is done when you cannot tell the person is acting. Zenobia Shroff is that type of actor. She so owns this character you cannot tell she is just acting a part. She is a delight as Kamala's mother and I wanted to see more of her and hope we do see more of her in the future.

title: Highest, furthest, fastest
text: Marvels 2023 takes audiences on a thrilling ride through the Marvel Cinematic Universe, delivering an experience that is nothing short of fantastic. From start to finish, this film captivates with its gripping storyline, impressive visuals, and a stellar cast that effortlessly embodies their iconic characters.One of the key strengths of Marvels 2023 lies in its ability to seamlessly blend action, humor, and heart. The narrative unfolds with a perfect balance, keeping viewers on the edge of their seats while also providing moments of genuine emotion. The script is cleverly written, offering a fresh perspective on familiar characters and introducing new elements that add depth to the Marvel lore.The ensemble cast of Marvels 2023 deserves accolades for their outstanding performances. Each actor not only brings their A-game but also manages to embody the essence of their respective characters. The chemistry among the cast members is palpable, enhancing the overall viewing experience. From the charismatic heroes to the menacing villains, the casting choices prove to be spot-on, creating a synergy that elevates the film.The Marvels 2023 is a feast for the eyes. The special effects are nothing short of spectacular, bringing the comic book world to life in vivid detail. The action sequences are impeccably choreographed, showcasing the superhuman abilities of the characters in jaw-dropping fashion. The cinematography and CGI work together seamlessly to create a visually stunning spectacle that stays true to the grandeur of the Marvel universe.Beyond the action and spectacle, Marvels 2023 also succeeds in injecting humor into the narrative. The witty dialogue and well-timed comedic moments provide a welcome breather without compromising the overall intensity of the plot. This balance contributes to the film's broad appeal, making it enjoyable for both hardcore Marvel fans and casual moviegoers.This movie is a triumph for the Marvel Cinematic Universe. It manages to capture the essence of what makes superhero films so beloved while also pushing the boundaries to deliver a fresh and exhilarating experience. The stellar cast, engaging storyline, and impressive visuals come together to create a cinematic journey that is not to be missed. Whether you're a die-hard Marvel fan or a casual movie enthusiast, Marvels 2023 is a must-watch that will leave you eagerly anticipating the next chapter in the ever-expanding Marvel universe.

title: One more bad review!
text: One hour and forty-five minutes too long! Absolutely stupid movie with a stupid plot. Captain Marvel was far better than this diatribe. The only characters who were still consistently good were Brie, Samuel and Tessa, all the rest were rubbish. Kamala and Spiderman are in a strong tie for the worst and most annoying Marvel characters!The music selection was absolutely terrible and at points really really annoying especially 17:55 to 21:00 range in the fighting scenes.For a minute I thought it was a Bollywood movie, with all the singing and dancing which was nonsensical. The other two MCU movies which were made at the same time, the new Thor and Guardians of the Galaxy movies were far better than this rubbish! I don't know what DaCosta was thinking to be honest!And yes it is ridiculous how Monica the daughter is two months older than Mary the mother in real life! Was there really a shortage of actresses to play Monica? Really? One more bad review!

title: nothing to Mar-Vell at
text: The MCU's 33rd film serves as further proof that the once thriving comic book juggernaut is now running on fumes. For reasons not explained very well, the world-weary Carol Danvers, scientific Monica Rambeau, and youthful Kamala Khan form a trifecta when their electromagnetically altered powers put them in a switchy entanglement situation. With all that going on, they then tangle with the villainous Dar-Benn (looking like the illegitimate daughter of Ronan--cough, cough) who's using her hammer thingy in the name of Hala to siphon atmospheres as vengeance against the "annihilator." The production costs of this Marvel Comics misstep may have been a king's ransom but the results certainly aren't worthy of royal adulation; tonally it's all over the place with familial sentiment, goofy humor that belongs in a sitcom, random song and dance, and other poorly developed subplots. Vellani has the most pep in her step, Larson looks a bit aloof, Parris does what she can do, meanwhile big bad Ashton clenches her teeth a lot but doesn't get to do anything interesting. The lowest grossing MCU picture to date generated some controversy as perturbed cast and crew members insinuated that external factors contributed to its downfall, but given the quality of the finished results it's pretty easy to balk at that. Memo to Marvel: you may want to revamp your product, otherwise you'll continue to disintegrate and put out subpar showings like this one. **
